name: Spacious One Bedroom Located in Welch
priceDetails/0/value: $10 per night after the first guest
primaryHost/about: My wife Elise and I have lived in McDowell County since November 2015. We moved from New England to help the community through outreach and ministry and we've fallen in love with the area and the people here. We love to go for walks, listen to music, travel anywhere & everywhere, and meet new friends.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. The apartment is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy our newly remodeled apartment in the heart of historic Welch. This unit was designed with the traveling professional in mind; quiet, easily accessible and comfortable.

Our spacious one bedroom is the perfect getaway for travelers to the area. Whether you are a nurse, teacher, other working professional or are just looking to stay in Welch, this is the place for you. 

We offer optimal Wi-Fi and have a television with a Roku for your viewing pleasure. 

A fully equipped kitchen and pleasant dining room will cater to any culinary needs.

Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. The apartment is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.

There is truly no other place like Welch, WV. Once a booming coal town, Welch now has a much smaller population. Welch and McDowell County have garnered much attention over the past decade. The New York Times and CNN have published and produced different pieces highlighting the county and its unique way of life that still exists here in the mountains. Even the late chef, author, and documentarian, Anthony Bourdain spent time filming in McDowell and was quoted saying it was one of the most unique places he had traveled to.
 https://www.wvpress.org/breaking-news/anthony-bourdain-mcdowell-best-place-earth/

You can see McDowell County's episode on season 11 of Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown.

This home is within walking distance to a gas station, a library, town hall and the movie theatre. The Jack Caffrey Arts and Culture Center is a short distance away. Small shops, grocery stores and restaurants are all one to five miles away. There is a Bluefield Area Transit Bus route that runs through town on weekdays.

There are stairs leading up to the house and upon entry, there are stairs leading to the unit.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please leave beds unmade.
We prefer no shoes in the apartment.

name: Bear Cabin -Hatfield & McCoy Trails
sectionedDescription/description:
Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages are non-smoking, sleep up to 4 people and provide all the comforts of home. We are located near the Hatfield & McCoy trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. Cottages and cabins include Heat / AC mini splits, Free Wi-Fi, mini kitchen, Keurig coffee maker, refrigerator, three-quarter bath, 32” TV with Netflix/Directv, fresh linens, bath towels & housekeeping service. Outdoor fire pit and charcoal grill. Privacy fence on the premises.

Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, charcoal grill and pinic table. There is also a second rental available,  " Papa's Den-Hatifield & McCoy Trails", on Airbnb as well that sleeps 3 people. These cabins are located on the same property. There is plenty of parking for trailers and ATVs / SXS and easy access to Hatfield and Mccoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails.

Drive directly to the Hatifield and McCoy trailheads on your SXS. 
Large Parking lot at the cabins.

We pride ourselves on your fun and crazy adventure while staying at Trail Bandits Cabins. Please help us keep it just as fun for our community and our fellow campers. Please read over our rental terms and conditions.

As always, remember to UNLEASH YOUR ADVENTURE!

Our Policy

Cabin rental incidental deposits are non-refundable if your reservation is cancelled with less than 30 days remaining before your arrival date.  Deposits for holiday/holiday weekends are not refundable under any conditions if cancelled.

Reschedule requests will be only be accepted if there are 30 days or longer remaining before your scheduled arrival date.  These requests are subject to availability. * Inclement weather cancellations will not be accepted.

Failure to adhere to your reservation with no communication will forfeit your deposit and you will be charged the remaining balance of your stay.

Cabin Terms and Conditions

Check-in time is 3pm on your arrival date, and check out time is 11am on your departure date. 

Guests will be charged a one time $50 cleaning fee at the time of reservation.

Cabins are non-smoking.  Guests will be charged a one time $250 cleaning fee if smoking is detected inside the cabins and you will forfeit your deposit.

The maximum capacity per standard cabin is 3 adults.  The maximum capacity for our larger cabin is 4 adults.   Violators will be evicted, and no refund will be issued.  Small children will be exempt from this rule. 

Playing on loft ladders is prohibited. Face the ladder when going up or down. Do not carry objects in your hands while on the ladder.

Park ONLY in the designated parking areas which is in front of your cabin or across the road in the grass area.  

Alcohol is permitted.  Disorderly conduct is not allowed.

*No atv or any off road vehicles are allowed in any of the rivers.

Please honor the posted speed limit in our atv community.  

The reserving guests will be responsible for any damages to your cabin or premises. 

Please do not place, burn or leave trash in your fire pit. Outside charcoal grills need to be cleaned prior to the departure of your stay.

We ask that all guest respect your fellow campers and community. 

Quiet the noise after 10:00pm for respect of the community and other campers.

No excessive riding in the cabin areas or driveways.   No driving or parking your ATV on the grass where the charcoal grills and picnic tables are located.

There are outdoor surveillance cameras around the campground for the protection of your items.

Ready to Reserve!

You must reserve with an incidental deposit of $250. Incidental deposits are refundable upon checkout as long as there are no damages or additional charges made. If additional charges or damages occur during your stay, you will receive the incidental deposit back less the cost of damages or additional charges. Cabins cannot be reserved and will not be held without a deposit.

All rentals require a 2-night minimum.

Pet Friendly – We love Pets!

Trail Bandits Cabins offers pet friendly cabins. 

Pets that are non-aggressive are allowed with a $20 per pet surcharge per night.  No more than 1 pet is allowed per cabin unless approved by host for more.

All pets must be registered at check-in. If not registered and found on the premises, you will be evicted and deposit forfeited.

Excessive barking that is a disturbance to other campers will not be allowed.  

**Pets must be crated if left alone.

Pets should be on a leash at all times while outside. Please clean up any waste left by your pet.

Reserving guest is responsible for any damages caused by pets. If any damages occur, incidental deposit will be forfeited.

Pets must be 40 pounds or less due to insurance restrictions and campground policy procedures.

name: The Heartland Lodge w/50 amp RV site/full hookup
sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the whole house. House will be equipped with washer and dryer, stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, and microwave. The house is fully stocked with everything you need with all your amenities like shampoo and soap to towels and washcloths to pots and pans. We will have trail maps available at the house for your convenience. We also have a grill and outdoor area with a fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
Recently completely remodeled and in a great location. Less than 1/2 a mile from the Hatfield and McCoy Warrior trailhead, gas station and grocery. The warrior trail connects to 3 other trails Indian ridge, Pocahontas, & Pinnacle. You can access 400+ miles of H&M trails and unlimited amount of outlaw. This house is within 3 miles of 7 restaurants, 2 grocery stores and 3 trails (warrior/pinnacle/Indian ridge) Everything is accessible by ATV! We are here to make your trip the best trip ever!

Best location in the area!! In the heart of Hatfield and McCoy. We are less than a 1/2 a miles from the warrior trail and within 3 miles of the connector trail to Indian ride and pinnacle. Also Indian ridge connects to Pocahontas! So 4 trails accessible from this house. Not to mention unlimited amount of outlaw trails close by. It’s also within 3 miles of the trail head to the wagon wheel/riders paradise!! This house is located within 3 miles of Wendy’s, McDonald’s, Subway, Pizza Hut, Sterling Drive-In, huddle hut, and KFC. It’s also within 3 miles of a four wheeler store and repair shop, car wash, 2 grocery stores, 3 gas stations, advance auto, shoe show, family dollar, dollar tree, hardware store, and mechanic shop. Its within a mile of 2 drug stores and a movie theatre! It’s within 1 mile of linkous park which has FREE tennis courts, a basketball court, walking path, and a nice playground for kids. There’s also a very nice outdoor pool there also! Theres a great outdoor area at the house for just setting around the campfire and enjoying the evening after a great day riding the Hatfield and McCoy trails, white water rafting, skiing, hunting, or hiking the great mountains of WV! All amenities are included and then some!!  We have grill, WiFi, washer and dryer, stove, refrigerator, dish washer, 6 beds, and a fully stocked house with everything you need. We also have trail maps available at the house. Everything is accessible by ATV once you get here there’s no need to get back in your vehicle!! No trailering needed to get to any of these places!! If you need more room we have a nice camper that sleeps 10 that we can pull in and set up for additional guests. We also rent out kayaks and our Honda pioneer 1000 which is a 5 seater in a package deal if needed and we have a 50 amp full hookup for a camper. To use the hookup it will be an additional $50 a night to be paid at the time of booking. Ask for details on RV hookup or any of these extras we will have to do that outside of Airbnb..So come and enjoy some southern hospitality! We want you to make your trip a yearly experience! Come and enjoy the mountains of West Virginia!! Looking forward to seeing you soon!!

You will have access to the whole house. House will be equipped with washer and dryer, stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, and microwave. The house is fully stocked with everything you need with all your amenities like shampoo and soap to towels and washcloths to pots and pans. We will have trail maps available at the house for your convenience. We also have a grill and outdoor area with a fire pit.

We are available for questions at anytime. We are here to make your stay one you will never forget and make into a yearly tradition!! We are local and will be happy to help you out in any way possible. Feel free to contact us at anytime! We look forward to accommodating your stay to West Virginia!!

Once you book your trip we will give you the access code to the door entrance.

name: Black Diamond ATV Lodge
primaryHost/about: I love riding in West Virginia and want to share my place with you
sectionedDescription/access: Full access
sectionedDescription/description:
The Black Diamond ATV Lodge in Welch, WV is the perfect place to stage your next Hatfield McCoy trails adventure.  Consider this your second home as you will have the whole house just for you.  On the main floor there are 3 bedrooms, living room, dining, kitchen, laundry, and bath. See guidebook for more details.

The whole house plus the garage is yours to use

Full access

email at blackdiamondwelchwv@gmail.com

Three major trail heads close by copies of Hatfield maps can be emailed as well as picked up at any pass retailer there are copies in the living room (please leave for the next guest)

Lots of parking  can accommodate three trucks and trailers

Cameras aren’t in use after check in

photos/14/caption: Guests have access to the front yard

We moved from New England to help the community through outreach and ministry and we've fallen in love with the area and the people here. We love to go for walks, listen to music, travel anywhere & everywhere, and meet new friends.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. It is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the modern and vintage charm of our 1920's home. Located in the heart of McDowell County in Welch, West Virginia. We take pride in offering the most comfortable hypoallergenic bedding for a wonderful night's sleep and the softest towels so our guests will have a lavish experience.

This apartment is located in a home with an additional unit across the hall and it is above another apartment. It is located across the way from City Hall and the Welch Library.

We thoroughly clean and disinfect after each guest's stay. The cleaners and detergents used on our property are eco-friendly, sustainable and biodegradable.

Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. It is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.

As hosts, we are always available for any assistance and advice while guests navigate the area.

There is truly no other place like Welch, WV. Once a booming coal town, Welch now has a much smaller population. Welch and McDowell County have garnered much attention over the past decade. The New York Times and CNN have published and produced different pieces highlighting the county and its unique way of life that still exists here in the mountains. Even the late chef, author, and documentarian, Anthony Bourdain spent time filming in McDowell and was quoted saying it was one of the most unique places he had traveled to.
 https://www.wvpress.org/breaking-news/anthony-bourdain-mcdowell-best-place-earth/

You can see McDowell County's episode on season 11 of Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown.

This home is within walking distance to a gas station, a library, town hall and the movie theatre. The Jack Caffrey Arts and Culture Center is a short distance away. Small shops, grocery stores and restaurants are all one to five miles away. There is a Bluefield Area Transit Bus route that runs through town on weekdays.

There is no kitchen in this unit. There is a key code for the front door of the house and for the apartment door. There are stairs  leading to this apartment.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
We prefer no shoes in the apartment. 
Please leave beds unmade.
sectionedDescription/interaction: As hosts, we are always available for any assistance and advice while guests navigate the area.

sectionedDescription/description:
We are a family orientated facility, proud to offer quality large two-bedroom apartments featuring spacious private bathrooms, entertainment space, full kitchens. Bramwell, “Home of the Millionaires” is not to be missed!
We are ATV friendly and parking is available for trucks and trailers. The original Pocahontas Trailhead is just down the road. Pocahontas connects you to Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trail systems as well as outlaw trails.
This apartment has 1 king, 1 queen, & 1 full sleeper sofa.

additionalHouseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "The Fox Den"
photos/16/caption: A sunset you will never forget! Romantic Getaway!
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, mini fridge, and hot plate.

There is also a second and a third rental just above this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "Hangar 22" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Enjoy the sounds and setting of living in the country.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi.

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

The Fox Den is named and themed (decor) after Virginia State Trooper Andrew D. Fox.  Andrew was a native to Tazewell County and a graduate from Tazewell High School.  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.

additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out please contact (304)-589-5789
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

name: Spurrier Unit 1 (2 Bedroom 1 Bath Pets Allowed)
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully updated 2 full-bed 1-bath apartment features a complete kitchen with all the necessities, free Wi-Fi, and a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Includes two queen bed, towels & washcloths for 4 guests, and a charcoal grill on the covered balcony. Central heat & air. Pets allowed with additional per-pet fee. You will be just a short ride to all the Hatfield/McCoy trail systems.

***FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL***

ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

2 Bedroom Apartment *Bluewell Area*

GPS Address: 219 Spurrier Rd., Bluefield, WV 24701

Everything you need in one place!
Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?
If so, you have found the right place!

Spurrier Apt. 1
This rental has a full bed in both of the two bedrooms. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests.

It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, new flooring, and leather dual-reclining sofa in the living room. This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator, and charcoal grill for your use on your private, covered, back patio! We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of full-sized closets with dressers in both bedrooms. There is a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each to watch your favorite Red Box movies on.

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE WIFI, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go up steps to get to this two-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

Contactless check-in and check-out is a must. You are emailed your door code and once inside you have an extra security door lock.
• 3:00PM check-in / 11:00AM check-out

Units are only available for out-of-town guests or corporate and business professionals looking for a temporary place to stay in the area.

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.

sectionedDescription/access: With rental you have access to the entire house with the exception of the garage.
sectionedDescription/description:
Families, Couples, Reunions, Guys Trip, Girls Trip and many other groups head to West Virginia to enjoys time on top of Browning Lambert Mountain. Whether you desire the ultimate experience in off road riding on local or Hatfield-McCoy Trails, rafting, hiking, snow skiing or sight seeing; Southern West Virginia has a little something for everyone. Enjoy your privacy beside our fire pit,  during corn hole competition, or while grilling a favorite meal after a long day on top of the mountain.

The Lodge is located on top of Browning Lambert Mountain.  The Lodge is located on the Hatfield McCoy Trail System and adjacent to local trails.  Pocahontas is the closest Trail System to the Lodge with direct access to Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior Trail Systems.  The Lodge has 3 bedrooms and 3 baths, a fully appointed kitchen and Living Room.  There is a covered front porch which allows access to the Lodge and Loft (Bedroom 3), a covered deck accessed from the living room and an uncovered outdoor deck.  The property has 2 fire pits, 2 charcoal grills, a gas grill and has a fenced in back yard which can be used to secure vehicles and  other items you would like to keep under lock and key.

With rental you have access to the entire house with the exception of the garage.

I am available for questions about the Lodge as well as in emergency situations.

The Lodge is located in a rural West Virginia community at the top of a mountain.

The lodge boasts ample parking of large truck/trailer combinations and a circle drive for easy turn around.  Guests can access local towns such as Bramwell and Bluewell on their ATV or in their vehicles.

Wifi is available through StarLink

	Put all trash (In Bags) in bin at street
	Leave all furniture in its original position

sectionedDescription/description: Highwater Inn is conveniently located in Mullens just a little over one mile from The Hatfield-McCoy trail system and the newly constructed Coal Fields Expressway.  The inn accommodates up to 10 guests and provides free Wifi, a kitchen, three showers, two decks, and an outdoor area with a picnic table, chairs, and fire pit .  Parking is plentiful for several vehicles, ATVs, and trailers with gas available just a few hundred yards away.  Multiple restaurants are just a short ride or walk away.

name: Hatfield @ Busted ATV Resort
primaryHost/about: Adventure seeking and nature lover!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
For those of you that Ride Dirty , Sleep Clean  - thank you!  Your Busted experience on Mt Me. is created by You for You. It has been with your help that the oldest house in Bramwell is rejuvenated to it's original 1880 beauty. With your continued support My great friend Rob and I will continue to build Busted A in way that's perfect for all our needs. God bless!
Pat

The Hatfield offers you the comforts of home. Three bedrooms , two baths a kitchen and living space that is ready for your group.  Remember to ride dirty but sleep clean in the Hatfield@ Busted ATV Resort We're just a mile from the Bramwell trail head that enters Hatfield McCoy's - Pocahontas , Indian Ridge , Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trails. Want more trails? Virginia Spearhead Trail system is just a five mile ride away.   If the historic Main Lodge and McCoy lodge are already booked than the Hatfield offers you the next best choice in the Hatfield McCoy territory. Hatfield now offers you a Turbo Master 4000 boot drier.
Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

For driving directions just enter (Busted ATV Resort) into your favorite mapping app.

Riding dirty on your ATV of course

Winter Rates and special accommodations opening up for next winter 2019 . 

Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a great price in-season months (April - October) is by winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to stay at Busted ATV Resort contact us first. We require a 30 day notice on Bookings from mid November to Mid March. Don't forget to follow us on Facebook for the latest info on Busted.

name: Burkes Garden Cottage
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Experience the beauty and culture of Southwest Virginia and enjoy the serenity of mountain life in beautiful Burkes Garden. This picturesque farming community sits in the highest valley in Virginia designated a Rural Historic District. Nestled beside the Parsonage Guest House, our cottage called "the Little House" is a vintage 50's cottage but with all the modern conveniences. With one queen and one  double bed it is perfect for 3 to 4 people or a couple's retreat.

The entire house is rented to one party at a time.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a back yard.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 3BR 2BA house with pool, is located Trailside at the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trailhead at Coaldale WV. Direct access to Pocahontas Spearhead Trail in VA and 500mi of OFF Road adventures from our location On Rt 52 just 13 miles from I-77 exit 1

This upstairs unit features 3 bedroom, 2 full baths with a full kitchen, dining room, sun room, living room and a washer/dryer. It will sleep 10 or 12 and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker, full size fridge, oven, pots/pans, microwave and crock pot, grills, picnic tables, fire-pits, basically everything you need to cook or heat up your meals. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding or just kick back relax and enjoy the amenities. Direct "Trailhead" access to over 500 miles of West Virginia's Trails and Virginia's most popular trails. Ride Four Hatfield McCoy trail systems from our "Trailside" location: Pocahontas, Indian Ridge, Pinnacle and the new Warrior Trails and Virginia's Spearhead trails. We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees. Discounts for multiple unit rentals (Coaldale Condo/Miners Den) available.Truly a Four Wheeler Heaven! Rent all three units for complete Privacy including the Pool Too ! Pool in season from Memorial to Labor Days.

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a back yard.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes. Atv rentals are available near by

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.
sectionedDescription/interaction: When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.
sectionedDescription/notes: Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes. Atv rentals are available near by
sectionedDescription/space: This upstairs unit features 3 bedroom, 2 full baths with a full kitchen, dining room, sun room, living room and a washer/dryer. It will sleep 10 or 12 and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker, full size fridge, oven, pots/pans, microwave and crock pot, grills, picnic tables, fire-pits, basically everything you need to cook or heat up your meals. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding or just kick back relax and enjoy the amenities. Direct "Trailhead" access to over 500 miles of West Virginia's Trails and Virginia's most popular trails. Ride Four Hatfield McCoy trail systems from our "Trailside" location: Pocahontas, Indian Ridge, Pinnacle and the new Warrior Trails and Virginia's Spearhead trails. We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees. Discounts for multiple unit rentals (Coaldale Condo/Miners Den) available.Truly a Four Wheeler Heaven! Rent all three units for complete Privacy including the Pool Too ! Pool in season from Memorial to Labor Days.
sectionedDescription/summary: This 3BR 2BA house with pool, is located Trailside at the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trailhead at Coaldale WV. Direct access to Pocahontas Spearhead Trail in VA and 500mi of OFF Road adventures from our location On Rt 52 just 13 miles from I-77 exit 1
sectionedDescription/transit: Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

I am from Lexington, NC. I have 2 boys and a beautiful wife. I have a vacuum business that allows me to travel all over the United States. We love riding as a family. It is great family time. This is what we want to provide a great relaxing trip for friends and family to enjoy. 
Don't put off what you can do today because tomorrow is never promised!

sectionedDescription/description:
We are located in Northfork WV at the Hatfield and McCoy trail systems, we are directly on the Outlaw trails .  We offer a fully furnished home to rent in the area. Jake's Grocery is located at the end of the road on the corner. We are around a mile away from Ashland Resort, so there is access to gas while you ride. We offer access to tours of the area and trail systems, we also have connections for you to rent ATVs and UTVs if needed. Easy access to the house from Highway 52.

This is a HOUSE with all the house comforts. Way more room than you would believe by looking from the outside.

Our location boasts access to all the local fun & attractions including Riders Inn (Local Bar & Grill), The Creek trails, Rebel Ridge, The View, The Goldfish Pond, and the Wagon Wheel.

Text or call 336-240-6445 or 704-308-8610

Quite and laid back. No drama! Swing on the porch and enjoy the WV mountains!

Ride your sxs, four wheelers,dirt bikes on the road anywhere

name: Long Neck Lair Alpaca Farm
photos/1/caption: Enjoy the view from our patio.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy relaxing on our patio, or get to know our alpacas.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a relaxing stay on our alpaca farm, Long Neck Lair, overlooking the picturesque Appalachian Trail.  We offer a comfortable private room in our home for business travel or vacation/getaway travel.  We share opportunities for our guests to interact with and learn about our alpacas. Convenient location off of I 81 at exit 54 on Route 11 N between Marion, Virginia and Wytheville, Virginia.

First floor room in our home has a private entrance and private bathroom. In room amenities include comfortable queen sofa bed, television, mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer.

Enjoy relaxing on our patio, or get to know our alpacas.

We are excited to share our farm with our guests! We are available to answer questions and share southern hospitality.

Long Neck Lair is in a rural setting, yet conveniently located to the towns of Marion, VA and Wytheville, VA. Marion is a ten minute drive away and is home to Hungry Mother State Park and Lincoln Theatre. Wytheville is a fifteen minute drive away and offers museums, entertainment, and history. Both towns have restaurants and shopping.  There are two restaurants within walking distance of our farm.

Our farm, Long Neck Lair, is located on Route 11 North approximately 1/2 mile off of I 81 at exit 54. Access to the Appalachian Trail is 3/10 of a mile from our farm.Please check the Mountain Lynx Transit website for information on limited transportation in our area.

Please contact us for same day availability.
Our farm is home to alpacas, chickens, dogs, and cats. Please take note, if you have allergies.
(Room rate includes 10.3% state and local taxes.)

name: Indian Creek Retreat
primaryHost/about: I am a pharmacist from rural Appalachian Virginia. Married with 2 adult children with whom I enjoy traveling the world whenever possible.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire downstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.
sectionedDescription/description:
1 Bedroom apartment in Cedar Bluff Virginia town limits. Sleeps 2-4. Friendly community. Tranquil setting in a rural town with a creek flowing nearby. 5 minutes to Richlands, Virginia. 10 minutes from the local hospital, Clinch Valley Medical Center.  20 minutes to Tazewell Virginia. 15 minutes to the Dragon's Back. 75 minutes to Bristol Motor Speedway. Multiple 4-wheeler trails nearby. Local Trout streams 30 minutes in any direction. Washer/Dryer access. Free Coffee.  Free Wifi.  Free Parking.

Grocery stores and pharmacies are conveniently located only 6 minutes away. Only 1 mile from the Blue Tornadoes Football field. If you happen to be a football fan you can find the whole town at Richlands High School on Friday nights during the fall.

The entire downstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.

Available by phone. We live locally so are available in the event of an emergency.

Enjoy gorgeous foliage and a breathtaking view at Cedar Bluff Overlook. It is about a 30-minute hike on a marked trail. Enjoy scenic drives through the Clinch Mountains, East River Mountains, and the Appalachian Mountains all around the area.
The Cedar Bluff Heritage Festival occurs annually on the third Saturday of September. You will find antique dealers and food vendors among many other activities. The festival attracts thousands of visitors and hundreds of vendors each year.  OKTOBREWFEST is a festival that is held on beautiful historic Main St. Tazewell, VA the first Saturday of October and was created to promote the craft beer industry in southwest VA and the surrounding area. It is the Premier Craft Beer Festival of the Heart of Appalachia.  There are several local restaurants of note, Cuz’s restaurant has been named the best in off-the-beaten-track restaurant categories. Bearded Moose is a frequented local barbecue restaurant loved by locals, and you can enjoy a sweet treat at Sugarfoot Bakery only 6 minutes away. Painted Peak Brewing Company is approximately 25 minutes away from the apartment where you can sample local brews. Multiple hiking trails and 4 wheeler trails are options for your entertainment. Kayaking and canoeing are available at local lakes and rivers. Enjoy Crab Orchard Museum located about 15 minutes away to learn more about the history in our area.
The apartment is located approximately 30 min from the Appalachian College of Pharmacy and approximately 13 minutes from Southwest Community College. Raven Theater is a historic site located about 10 minutes away. Limited show-times and hours, but when they are open it is a special stop for soda fountain ice cream.  Broadway Cinemas is the local contemporary theater located about 6 minutes away.

The town of Cedar Bluff has sidewalks with lights and you can enjoy a leisurely afternoon stroll. 4 County Transit offers public transportation. Town route fare is 25¢ per boarding.
Work express fare is 50¢ per boarding.
College routes are public routes and open to anyone who wants to ride. Fare for public riders is $1.00 per boarding.
College route fare is FREE for college students and staff/faculty who present college ID, seniors at least 60 years old, and children 5 or younger who are accompanied by an adult.
At your request, the bus can stop at other locations that are along its route. This is a route deviation service. 
Please call at least 48 hours in advance with your requests. 
Check out their website for additional information.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Please load the dishwasher prior to check-out. Quiet hours after 10pm to not disturb neighbors.

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Explore “Nature’s Air-Conditioned City,” from the comfort of this 4-bedroom, 2-bath vacation rental in Bluefield! Along with its mild climate, Bluefield is known for its delicious barbecue, ATVing, and historic attractions, including the Pocahontas Exhibition Coal Mine & Museum, not far from this house. Bring the whole gang along to enjoy the proximity to multiple parks, from Lotito City Park to Pinnacle Rock State Park, or simply hang out in the private yard, complete with a covered patio!

Game Room | Yard w/ Covered Patio | 2,200 Sq Ft

With all the comforts of home and a convenient location near local eats, historic spots, and outdoor adventure, this Bluefield abode is perfect for a family seeking a laid-back getaway!

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Twin/Full Bunk Bed | Bedroom 3: 2 Twin/Full Bunk Beds | Bedroom 4: 2 Twin Beds

INDOOR LIVING: 3 Smart TVs, game room w/ pool table
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, cooking basics, drip coffee maker, dining table for 6
GENERAL: Free WiFi, linens, complimentary toiletries, central heat & air conditioning, washer/dryer
FAQ: 3 external security cameras (around perimeter, facing out), step-free access (from the backyard), towels not provided
PARKING: Garage (1 vehicle), driveway (6 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OUTDOOR FUN: Lotito City Park (3.6 miles), Pinnacle Rock State Park (4.4 miles), Pocahontas Trail Head (6.3 miles), Glenwood Recreational Park (7.9 miles), Pocahontas Trail Head (9.4 miles), Princeton Youth Park (11.8 miles), Pipestem Resort State Park (29.4 miles), Fort Chiswell Animal Park (45.8 miles), New River Gorge National Park and Preserve (77.0 miles)
HISTORIC SPOTS: Pocahontas Exhibition Coal Mine & Museum (9.8 miles), Princeton Railroad Museum (13.3 miles), Wolf Creek Indian Village (18.9 miles), Big Walker Lookout (32.5 miles)
LOCAL EATS: Portabella One (2.6 miles), The Blue Spoon Cafe (3.0 miles), Shogun Bluefield (4.2 miles), Patty Joe’s Restaurant (4.4 miles), Savory Flavors (4.5 miles)
AIRPORT: Roanoke-Blacksburg Regional Airport (101 miles)

sectionedDescription/summary: Explore “Nature’s Air-Conditioned City,” from the comfort of this 4-bedroom, 2-bath vacation rental in Bluefield! Along with its mild climate, Bluefield is known for its delicious barbecue, ATVing, and historic attractions, including the Pocahontas Exhibition Coal Mine & Museum, not far from this house. Bring the whole gang along to enjoy the proximity to multiple parks, from Lotito City Park to Pinnacle Rock State Park, or simply hang out in the private yard, complete with a covered patio!

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Rest and relaxation are what you can expect when you stay at this welcoming 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental home in Wytheville. The house boasts a large deck where you can soak up the sun, a fully equipped kitchen to cook family meals, a hot tub, patio, firepit, and a cozy fireplace where you can sit and read or share stories. There’s no shortage of recreation in this area - spend all day exploring the New River Trail State Park, Stone Mountain State Park, or the Pilot Mountain State Park.

3/4 Acres | Across from Big Survey Forest | Private Hot Tub

Nature lovers, homebodies, and adventure seekers are welcome at this inviting abode featuring comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces, and a quiet location. 

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Twin/Full Bunk Bed

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TV, bathtub, gas fireplace, expansive windows, natural lighting
OUTDOOR LIVING: Expansive deck, patio, gas grill, outdoor dining area, fire pit, hammock, private yard 
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, stainless steel appliances, blender, coffee maker, cooking basics, spices
GENERAL: Free WiFi, linens/towels, air conditioning, books, central heating, washer/dryer, laundry detergent, adjustable base bed, smoke detectors, fire hydrant
FAQ: Access only by stairs (single-story home inside, exterior steps only)
PARKING: Driveway (4 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OUTDOOR RECREATION: Crystal Springs Recreation area (3.4 miles), New River Trail State Park (19.4 miles), Hale Lake (21.3 miles), Comers Rock (23.7 miles), Dicky's Knob Trail (29.6 miles), Hungry Mother State Park (30.8 miles), Devils Nature Preserve (37.9 miles), Salt Trail (48.5 miles), Rowland Creek Falls (50.6 miles), Stone Mountain State Park (55.3 miles), Appalachian Trail at Mount Rogers (58.5 miles), Pilot Mountain State Park (69.7 miles)
THINGS TO DO: Fort Chiswell Animal Park (11.8 miles), The Blue Ridge Mountain Center (31.9 miles), Old Cranks Museum (36.6 miles), Jeff Matthews Museum (37.3 miles), High Country Lights (37.5 miles), Andy Griffith Museum (50.5 miles)
EAT + DRINK: 7 Dogs Brew Pub (2.1 miles), Graze on Main (2.3 miles), Chaus Corner Bakery (2.3 miles), Moon Dog Brick Oven (2.3 miles), Seven Sisters Brewery (2.4 miles), Log House 1776 Restaurant (2.5 miles), Peking Chinese Restaurant (3.3 miles), CJ’s Pizza (3.5 miles), Grayson Restaurant (3.9 miles), The Dutch Pantry (13.1 miles), Country Chicken (14.3 miles)
AIRPORT: Charlotte Douglas International Airport (144 miles)

name: The Company House of Pocahontas
photos/25/caption: The 2 lane, paved, and lit alley behind the house
photos/26/caption: The paved driveway behind the house
sectionedDescription/access: Guests get the whole house and the surrounding yard.
sectionedDescription/description:
Guests may use the entire house, 184 E. Water St., the yard, and the driveway. 
The house was built in 1883 and was occupied by my grandparents, my father actually grew up in this house. This was a Pocahontas Fuel company house.

The house has a living room, dining room, kitchen, four bedrooms, and 1.5 bathrooms. There is a large front porch with rocking chairs and a swing. A mudroom is off of the kitchen. You’re welcome to park in the driveway behind the house and put ATVs in the roped off area of the backyard. Trailers and trucks must be parked in the alley, but please don’t block the alley. Cars can be parked in front of the house.

Guests get the whole house and the surrounding yard.

I live 5 miles away so I am readily available. My phone number is 843–801– 2515. You can either call me or text and I keep my phone available at all times when I have a renter

Pocahontas is an ATV friendly town during day light hours. Please be considerate of noise, this house is in a residential section and the town quiet hours are 10 PM to 7 AM. Also please be respectful of Sunday morning church hours

There is a lockbox on the front door with two door keys in it. I will text you the code for the lock box once the house has been cleaned from the previous renters. The gate to the backyard has a lock on it and the key is hanging on a nail in the kitchen beside the back door. When you are leaving please put the gate key back on that nail and put the door keys back in the lock box.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: The town of Pocahontas requires that all trailers and ATV must be parked behind the house in the alley. Cars and trucks may park on the street in front of the house. I allow parking in my gated back yard and also in the driveway beside my garage

sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Adventures (formerly Bramwell ATV Resort) offers a comfortable stay in Appalachian paradise. Our 6 riverfront rentals are a minute from the Hatfield-McCoy trails.  If fishing's more your thing the Bluestone River is right out back. White-water rafting on the world-renowned Gauley or New River, zip-lining, hiking, biking or horseback riding at Pipestem Resort State Park...whatever fun mountain stuff you're into, you'll find it nearby.

Holiday weekends during high season (April-October) require a three-night minimum stay. Off-season dates (November-March) require a two-night minimum stay.  If you're interested in kayaking the Bluestone River, please speak with owner to make arrangements.

primaryHost/about: I taught school for 13 years. I assist my husband with our rental property. I enjoy painting and fixing up property.
sectionedDescription/access:
Quail Rd is the first green state rd. sign to the left past Buffalo Trail Resort.
Go over the bridge and stay to the left. Stay straight.
Go to the very end of Quail Rd and the house has a red roof.
Trucks and trailers HAVE TO ENTER the upper left gravel driveway and turn left. This driveway loops downward. You drive to the lower end and backup your trailer into the graveled area in the corner. Two trucks and trailers can park in this corner. This will allow more room for trucks and trailers to park on the lower gravel. Large trailers over 30ft need to exit out the upper gravel road where you entered.
sectionedDescription/description:
Large spacious house for families and friends! Ride your ATV anywhere! No trailering to HM trails (Pocahontas 2 miles)  Indian Ridge, Pinnacle, Warrior, Spearhead & the Outlaw Trails! Lots of parking for many trailers! With all the ATVs going by on 71, there's peace and quiet on this nestled 4 acres up the hill at the end of Quail Rd.  Grill on the patio, stay warm in the family room with a gas fireplace, or sit by the fire pit. Restaurants, gas, grocery, car wash, and laundromat nearby.

Main Bedroom One has 1 king bed
Bedroom Two has 1 queen bed and 3 twin beds
Bedroom Three has 2 queen beds 
Bedroom Four has 1 queen bed and 1 twin bed
Bedroom Five has 1 queen 
The large family room is 20 x 30 and has a Lazyboy pullout sofa and there’s an Airbed available

Quail Rd is the first green state rd. sign to the left past Buffalo Trail Resort.
Go over the bridge and stay to the left. Stay straight.
Go to the very end of Quail Rd and the house has a red roof.
Trucks and trailers HAVE TO ENTER the upper left gravel driveway and turn left. This driveway loops downward. You drive to the lower end and backup your trailer into the graveled area in the corner. Two trucks and trailers can park in this corner. This will allow more room for trucks and trailers to park on the lower gravel. Large trailers over 30ft need to exit out the upper gravel road where you entered.

Guests can contact me through email, text or call my phone.

Children play in the road so drive slowly on Quail Rd. Sometimes the neighbor's little dog will come up the driveway. He is a friendly dog.

Trailers enter at the upper, left gravel driveway and exit at the lower driveway.  Stay on the gravel especially with wet weather because the ground is slippery on the hillside. Don't park in front of the house.  You can drive your ATV on the gravel behind the house and unload at the patio.

Bag all trash and take out to the wooden box. 
If you park your SxS behind the house, be careful not to run into the propane tank. 
Quiet hours are between 12pm and 6am.

additionalHouseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, refrigerator and stove. 

There is also a second and a third rental near this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "The Iron Horse" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Please be aware there is a temporary drainage system installed at the front of the concrete pad, this may be a trip hazard, please watch your step.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi. 

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

Hangar 22 is built in memory of Sergeant Shawn Hess.  Sgt. Hess was killed in the line of duty while working as a Deputy Sheriff for Tazewell County Sheriffs Office..  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his friends and family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.


RECENTLY WE HAD TO INSTALL A NEW DRAINAGE SYSTEM AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CABIN.UNTIL THE GROUND SETTLES,THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT LIP ON THE EDGE OF THE CONCRETE PAD ENTRANCE. THIS WILL REQUIRE YOU TO TAKE A SMALL STEP UP, CREATING A TRIPPING HAZARD. PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS STEP UP. IT WILL BE MARKED WITH FLUORESCENT PAINT.PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS AND BE CAREFUL.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name:
2 bd 1.5 bath log Cabin
3 min from Pipestem Resort
sectionedDescription/access: Private drive and plenty of parking.
sectionedDescription/description:
Log Cabin just 3 minutes from Pipestem State Park.  This cabin offers 2 bedrooms 1.5 baths, is furnished with nice up to date furniture and beds, has central heat and air, fireplace,  3 Roku TVs, Washer Dryer,  Front and back screened porches. This is a great place to get away from it all. Cabin is within minutes of two lakes, three rivers, beautiful waterfalls, great fishing, hiking, golf courses, horseback riding, kayaking, zip lines, and nature trails. We're open year-round!

King master bedroom, Queen 2nd bedroom upstairs.  Furnished kitchen with new samsung washer dryer. Screened front and back porches with swing on both. coffee maker, and coffee provided.

Private drive and plenty of parking.

Host can be reached by email.  
rowz10.rb@gmail.com
phone: 229-848-0420

Peaceful quiet area in the country.  3 min from Pipestem Resort State Park.
Park offers bikingand hiking trails,  horseback riding, aerial tramway, zip lines, lake and river fishing. Waterfalls nearby, and  Bluestone lake and recreation area 15 miles away for boating and fishing. Marina with boat rentals available.

Car is the best way to get around the area. Park offers many biking and hiking trails.

Enjoy our cabin, and the area.
Please clean up behind yourself and wash dishes, remove bedding  and take trash to bins before leaving. 
Also no shoes inside please and thanks.

name: Richmond’s Meadow Creek Hideaway Cabin #4
p3SummaryAddress: Meadow Creek, West Virginia, United States
photos/1/caption: Sleeping loft.  Full size futon mattress with bedding.
photos/8/caption: Kitchen with microwave, coffee pot, dishware, three burner propane stove, refrigerator and ac unit.
photos/15/caption: Living room area with satellite tv.
primaryHost/about: Welcome to Richmond's Meadow Creek Hideaway.  My husband & I have owned our small vacation rental business for 15 years.  We own a full size cottage on the riverfront along with a separate garage Apartment.  Both are open year round.  From April to October, we have three cedar sided cabins also available for rental.  All of our properties are located in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, Summers County, West Virginia.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Our Cabin has free parking, a large wooden deck with a propane grill, a fire pit out back and firewood too.
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to Cabin #4, our fun sized hunting themed cabin.  Our cabin is 120 sf, roughly the size of a standard bedroom.  It has a loft with a full size futon mattress, a roll-up pillow top mat, (perfect for a child to sleep on), a futon sofa/bed, kitchenette, bath with shower, and a large deck.  The Cabin is fully furnished, has ac/heating, satellite tv, Wifi, and both a fire pit and wood. This cabin is open seasonally April through October yearly.

Our fun sized Cabin #4is located in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, three miles off I-64 at Meadow Creek.  We are a short drive to historic Hinton, WV, Lewisburg, White Sulphur Springs, and Fayetteville, WV.  

We are 4/10s of a mile from public access to the New River and to the Meadow Creek stream.

Our Cabin has free parking, a large wooden deck with a propane grill, a fire pit out back and firewood too.

My husband and I live in Meadow Creek and can be available as needed.

Our Cabins are located in the New River Gorge National Park at Meadow Creek.  We are an easy access to I-64.  Nearby attractions include the New, Greenbrier and Bluestone Rivers, Sandstone Visitors Center, Bluestone Lake, Pipestem State Park, Bluestone State Park, historic Hinton, WV, Lewisburg, White Sulphur Springs and Fayetteville, WV, and Winterplace Ski Resort.

Personal transportation.

Our Cabin is fully furnished with all linens, a coffee pot, microwave, toaster oven, dish ware, satellite tv and ac.

As Meadow Creek is a small railroad community, trains travel through Meadow Creek on no certain schedule.  You will hear the trains as well as their whistle.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
We hope you enjoy our fun sized cabin and simply ask that you clean-up after yourself by placing trash in the trash can provided, wash dishes, and place laundry in the hamper provided.  If you bring a dog, please clean-up after your dog and should you opt to leave your animal alone, please leave them in a crate in order to deter damage to our cabins.  
*Smoking is allowed in outside areas where sand buckets are placed for cigarette butts.
sectionedDescription/interaction: My husband and I live in Meadow Creek and can be available as needed.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Our Cabins are located in the New River Gorge National Park at Meadow Creek.  We are an easy access to I-64. name: Lucy's Mountain View
primaryHost/about: My husband and I are travel enthusiasts with a passion for exploring new places and trying new foods. We value the learning and personal growth that come with travel, and love sharing our experiences with others. That's why my husband and I decided to create Escape Vacation Rentals, where we can share our personal spaces with others from all over. We believe that travel has the power to broaden our horizons and connect us with people and places we might never have encountered otherwise. We hope you enjoy our little spaces as much as we do!!!

sectionedDescription/access: Whole cabin
sectionedDescription/description:
This cozy little cabin is the closest lodge to Braveheart and Rockhouse Trailheads. Located on the Guyandotte river, park your rig and ride your ATV’s anywhere.
Located in a quiet, peaceful community, you will see kids riding their bicycles, duck and geese in the backyard and a puppy or two needing a belly rub! Great folks to welcome you to Hatfield Mcoy trails! Try us once, you’ll be back!

Whole cabin

We are available 24/7 and always close by. As little or as much interaction as you wish!

Less than 1 mile to Rockhouse Trailhead and Braveheart Trailhead. Town of Man, food, nightlife, grocery store, Hardee’s, Wendy’s, Fuel, Dollar General, Ice cream and more!

Park your trailer and ride your machines anywhere!!!

Located in a quiet, peaceful community, you will see kids riding their bicycles, duck and geese in the backyard and a puppy or two needing a belly rub! Great folks to welcome you to Hatfield Mcoy trails! Try us once, you’ll be back!

name: Spacious ATV Retreat House
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
The perfect ATV adventure home! This 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom home offers plenty of space for your friends and family as well as enough parking for 5 trailers. The home is also equipped with a washer and dryer, charcoal grill, basic cable and internet.  You will also have convenient access to ATV trails!  House is located close to the Pocahontas trailhead and is a short ride to both Indian Ridge and Pinnacle Creek trails. Enjoy getting away from the hustle and bustle and breathe in the fresh countr

This ATV retreat has 1 king bed, 2 queen beds, and 2 full beds. The home is wheel chair accessible throughout and has a wheelchair access ramp. There is also a large two car garage and plenty of outside parking space.  The kitchen is fully equipped and there is ample living space to spend time with your loved ones.

Coordinates of the house are: 37º21'15N 81º15'01W

If you need to rent ATVs for your trip we recommend using - WV ATV Rentals, Crazy Mountain Cycles or Eagle ATV Rentals.

NO SMOKING
