primaryHost/about: I am a naturally curious person and have lived in many different states from California to Virginia.  I love to try new things and prefer experiences over things.  My family and I appreciate the simple, uncomplicated things.
sectionedDescription/access: You will have your own personal, private farmhouse located in the heart of the outdoorsman’s paradise. Feel free to workout in the gym, walk to the top of the mountain, store your ATVs, kayaks, canoes, mountain bikes, or other outdoor items in the outbuildings (bring your own lock).  Hang out on the back porch and watch the deer, turkeys and other wildlife graze in the fields, build a snowman(bring your own carrot nose) and take a sleigh ride down the hills or stay inside and watch the snow fall while drying your mittens on the radiators.
sectionedDescription/description:
Love to ski, tube or snowboard?  Is ATV riding your thing?  Horseback riding make you happy?  Hiking and exploring waterfalls, rivers, lakes and streams get you excited?  How about leaf peeping, bird and wildlife watching, kayaking, fishing, hunting, canoeing, mountain biking, whitewater rafting or ziplining?  We are a stone's throw from all of these things!

Our 100 year old farmhouse is located almost at the top of Flat Top Mountain, the highest elevation in southern West Virginia and on the opposite side of the mountain from Winterplace Ski Resort.  With beautiful views and a peaceful atmosphere, come and take a deep breath of fresh country air and relax.  Your stay is in our family’s 95+ year old farmhouse with great WiFi speeds and flat screen smart televisions. You can conduct Zoom meetings and work from “home” in the separate, sunshine filled office. We have a fully equipped gym located in a separate 2 story outbuilding and  facilities to house your horses, ATVs, canoes, kayaks and mountain bikes.

You will have your own personal, private farmhouse located in the heart of the outdoorsman’s paradise. Feel free to workout in the gym, walk to the top of the mountain, store your ATVs, kayaks, canoes, mountain bikes, or other outdoor items in the outbuildings (bring your own lock).  Hang out on the back porch and watch the deer, turkeys and other wildlife graze in the fields, build a snowman(bring your own carrot nose) and take a sleigh ride down the hills or stay inside and watch the snow fall while drying your mittens on the radiators.

I am available to chat if you’d like suggestions on things to do or see or have any questions whatsoever.

Country setting with quick and easy access to I-77 by going down either side of the mountain on Route 19.

Winterplace is approximately 10 minutes away and the Dept of Highways has snow removal down to a science.

ATV, horse, your own two feet or automobile.

There are so many outdoor activities to experience while staying with us, that it's virtually impossible to list them all.  However, I will take a shot.

From our house you can access the CC Trail (2 minutes away) an ATV, auto, mountain bike and horse trail that extends all the way to McDowell County, Blueberry Hills blueberry farm (5 minutes), Winterplace Ski Resort (10 minutes), Skyline Lodge Pub & Grill (5 minutes), Camp Creek State Park (horse friendly park with beautiful water falls and a swimming hole, 15 minutes) , Glade Springs Resort (golf, spa, fine dining) (15 minutes) for the fancier folk, Little Beaver State Park (20 minutes), Bluestone State Park and Dam (30 minutes), Pipestem Resort (offering trail rides with their horses or bring your own) (30 minutes), Pipestem Drive In (30 minutes), Burning Rock Outdoor Adventure Park (30 minutes), Grandview State Park (home of Theatre WV and live performances of "The Hatfields and McCoys"), Concord University (30 minutes),  both the New and Gauley Rivers (40 minutes), Harmony Hills Equestrian Center (40 minutes), Mountain Lake Resort (where parts of Dirty Dancing were filmed) (50 minutes), Pinnacle Creek-Hatfield-McCoy Trailhead (1 Hour), Pocahontas Trail System (1 Hour), Historic Bramwell (1 Hour),  Historic Hinton (40 minutes), The Summit Bechtel Reserve (location of the Boy Scout Jamboree) (40 minutes), Historic  Fayetteville and Thurmond a deserted ghost town (40 minutes).

There's also the Mystery Hole (don't forget to get the bumper sticker), Hawk's Nest scenic overlook, Babcock State Park (with a working grist mill) and so much more.

name: The Whitetail at Pipestem Place
primaryHost/about:
A "should have been" West Virginian...my parents were both born and raised in the Hills of WV and with grandparents, aunts, uncles and cousins mostly residing there for all of their lives, I spent most of my summers and any vacation time visiting and growing to love my “once removed” roots. Though I grew up in South Florida, I loved my summers there away from the Florida heat. I hiked in the woods, swam in cold streams, explored waterfalls and fell in love. Being adventurous, I rapelled in the New River Gorge, skiied for the first time at Snowshoe and learned a love of rafting that continues today as I pursue trips on many Western Rivers in New Mexico, Colorado, Utah and Arizona.Life took me out west to Santa Fe, New Mexico where I pursued an art career and eventually a Real Estate career. I feel blessed to have helped my mother find her dream cabins, and to now again get to spend family time in this wonderful place. Many friends and family are still nearby and it is like coming “home” to stay at the cabins on Anam Cara Way.

We hope you will find joy, and peace, and feel that our home is your home when you stay at our sweet cabins.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Whitetail is a conventional-style log cabin, cozy and appealing, with two bedrooms, two baths, living room, dining and kitchen; stone wood-burning fireplace, central A/C-heat. The Whitetail is reminiscent of the simple, tranquil country life as you swing or rock on the front porch, listen and watch for beautiful songbirds, deer and other wildlife that often wander across the meadow.   'Tis the peaceful life at Pipestem Place on Anam Cara Way!

The village of Pipestem and **Pipestem Resort State Park, one of WV's most outstanding parks, sit high on a plateau with deep canyons, converging rivers and streams, high rolling hills ~ a unique, diverse vacation land, a mecca for exploration, photography and recreation! Our two vacation log cabins, The Robin and The Whitetail are located in a natural, serene setting on Anam Cara Way in Pipestem, WV, only one-half mile from Pipestem Resort State Park.

We are available by phone, text or email at any time. Though we don't live nearby, we have a property manager available on short notice for any emergency.

Nearby Adventures :
Pipestem State Park has both an 18 hole and a 9 hole par 3 course, heated indoor and Olympic-size outdoor swimming pools, over 20 hiking trails, horseback riding, kyaking/boating/fishing, archery, camping, aerial tram, zip-line ((upcoming 2019), and many other recreational, educational and entertainment events and activities throughout the year.

White water rafting
There are several commercial wild water rafting companies, offering various levels of rafting. Most of our West Virginia whitewater rafting trips are a full-day adventure of approximately 6-8 hours - and include a specially-prepared riverside lunch and river equipment. No experience is necessary for any New River whitewater rafting trip. professional guides are in each raft.

Hiking
Hiking is great in the area, many trails to scenic waterfalls are nearby including Brush Creek Falls, Sandstone Falls and Pipestem State Park.

Winterplace in Beckley, WV has snow skiing in Winter and is also less than an hour away.
Bluestone Lake Recreational Area is about 9 miles down Hwy 20, and has swimming and boat rentals available in warmer seasons.

name: Cabin 2 at Bramwell Adventures-2 Min to Trail!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Adventures (formerly Bramwell ATV Resort) offers a comfortable stay in Appalachian paradise. Our 6 riverfront, pet-friendly* rentals are a minute from the Hatfield-McCoy trails. If fishing's more your thing the Bluestone River is right out back. White-water rafting on the world-renowned Gauley or New River, zip-lining, hiking, biking or horseback riding at Pipestem Resort State Park...whatever fun mountain stuff you're into, you'll find it nearby. *See Pet Policy in House Rules.

Cabin 2 is a large single-room efficiency on the riverfront with a kitchenette, private bathroom and shower, 2 bunk beds, and 2 lofts with 2 twin beds in each for a maximum capacity of 8 guests. The kitchenette is equipped with a compact refrigerator, 2-eye hotplate, dishes, pots, pans, cooking and eating utensils, coffee pot and microwave oven.  Cabins 1 and 2 are connected by a lockout door and may be rented together for a party of 14. WiFi is included, as well as onsite parking for trailers, trucks, and ATVs at no additional cost to our guests.

Holiday weekends during high season (April-October) require a three-night minimum stay. Off-season dates (November-March) require a two-night minimum stay.  Pets require an additional cleaning fee and guests must agree to pet policy.  (See House Rules for details.)  If you're interested in kayaking the Bluestone River, please speak with owner to make arrangements.

name: Beckley Studio w/ Hot Tub, 4 Mi to WVU Tech!
photos/0/caption: Beckley Vacation Rental | Studio | 1BA | Stairs Required | 900 Sq Ft
primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
No matter what brings you to town, this homey vacation rental in Beckley is the perfect place to call home. This 1-bathroom studio gives you easy access to WVU’s campus so you can visit the kids or tour the campus before school starts. When you’re not in downtown Beckley, take advantage of the natural beauty of West Virginia at New River Gorge National Park. And of course, your day wouldn’t be complete without a soak in the private hot tub or a movie snuggled up in front of the fire.

In-Unit Laundry | Fireplace  

Whether you’re visiting loved ones at WVU, working at a nearby hospital, or leaf-peeping at Backcock State Park, this cozy studio in Beckley is the perfect home base. 

Studio: Queen Bed, Twin Bed | Additional Sleeping: Pack ‘n Play 

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TVs w/ cable, board games, wood-burning fireplace, living area 
OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered patio, private hot tub, rocking chairs 
KITCHEN: Well-equipped w/ cooking basics, dishware & flatware, microwave, high chair, dining area 
GENERAL: Free WiFi, keyless entry, complimentary toiletries, linens & towels, in-unit washer & dryer, central heating & air conditioning, laundry detergent, hair dryer, trash bags & paper towels, iron & ironing board
FAQ: Homeowner on-site, stairs required for access, 2 exterior security cameras   
PARKING: Driveway (2 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OPT OUTSIDE: Word Park (3.0 miles), New River Gorge National Park and Preserve (10.4 miles), Little Beaver State Park (16.9 miles), Main Overlook (20.6 miles), Babcock State Park (39.3 miles), Bluestone National Scenic River (41.4 miles) 
HIKES: Ship Rock (7.5 miles), Little Laurel Trailhead (13.6 miles), Upper Glade Creek Trailhead (17.4 miles), Polls Plateau Trailhead (21.5 miles), Big Branch Trail (40.2 miles) 
THINGS TO SEE & DO: Downtown Beckley (3.2 miles), Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine (3.2 miles), Youth Museum of Southern WV (3.2 miles), Wildwood House Museum (4.5 miles), Alfred Beckley Mill (6.7 miles) 
AIRPORTS: Raleigh County Memorial Airport (10 miles), Yeager Airport (59.3 miles)
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
- No smoking
- No pets allowed  
- No events, parties, or large gatherings
- Must be at least 25 years old to book
- Additional fees and taxes may apply
- Photo ID may be required upon check-in
- NOTE: The homeowner lives on-site, in a separate unit with a separate entrance, and may be present during your stay
- NOTE: This property is located in the bottom unit of the property which requires stairs to access. This may be difficult for guests with limited mobility 
- NOTE: Your safety matters. This property features 2 external security cameras. These cameras are outward-facing and do not look into any interior spaces. Camera 1 is located on the deck facing out, and camera 2 is located on the the front of the home facing the steps. These cameras actively record video and audio when motion is detected and will be turned on during your stay

sectionedDescription/space:
In-Unit Laundry | Fireplace  

Whether you’re visiting loved ones at WVU, working at a nearby hospital, or leaf-peeping at Backcock State Park, this cozy studio in Beckley is the perfect home base. 

Studio: Queen Bed, Twin Bed | Additional Sleeping: Pack ‘n Play 

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TVs w/ cable, board games, wood-burning fireplace, living area 
OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered patio, private hot tub, rocking chairs 
KITCHEN: Well-equipped w/ cooking basics, dishware & flatware, microwave, high chair, dining area 
GENERAL: Free WiFi, keyless entry, complimentary toiletries, linens & towels, in-unit washer & dryer, central heating & air conditioning, laundry detergent, hair dryer, trash bags & paper towels, iron & ironing board
FAQ: Homeowner on-site, stairs required for access, 2 exterior security cameras   
PARKING: Driveway (2 vehicles)
sectionedDescription/summary: No matter what brings you to town, this homey vacation rental in Beckley is the perfect place to call home. This 1-bathroom studio gives you easy access to WVU’s campus so you can visit the kids or tour the campus before school starts. When you’re not in downtown Beckley, take advantage of the natural beauty of West Virginia at New River Gorge National Park. And of course, your day wouldn’t be complete without a soak in the private hot tub or a movie snuggled up in front of the fire.

additionalHouseRules:
-Prior to 11:00 on the day of departure, the Tenant will clean up the surrounding property before checkout otherwise check-out cleaning charges to you will result.  
-ACCOMMODATIONS: Tenant is responsible for keeping the unit clean and safe during the entire tenancy. Tenant has an obligation to notify Owner immediately of any safety issues discovered. In addition, Tenant is responsible for any and all damages to the property from all guests and ensuring maximum occupancy is not exceeded during his tenancy. Due to health department regulations, occupancy in homes served by septic systems is limited to two persons per bedroom, unless otherwise stated. 
-This cabin is designated as smoke free and therefore no smoking is permitted inside the structure.  
-All cabins are equipped for normal housekeeping. Each unit includes an electric coffee pot and toaster as basic kitchen equipment; dishwasher, washer/dryer, central air/heat, and microwave. All beds will have linens and pillows provided.
-Mail, texts, and phone messages can be sent to 304-466-4444 or carolynpricestephens@gmail.com or 624 Tallery Mountain Road, Hinton, WV 25951.
-CHECK-OUTS: All cabins must be vacated by 11:00 on check-out day. We ask that this policy be recognized by all Tenants. An extra day’s rent will be charged for all late check-outs unless advance arrangements have been made for late check out (limited availability and subject to additional fee.  Lessee is responsible for washing dishes, bagging trash, emptying refrigerator, leaving the AC set on 78 degrees (or heat set on 55 degrees in the winter months), securing all doors and windows, and leaving the unit clean, damage-free and in good condition for the next renter. Any extra cleaning or excessive trash removal will be billed to Tenant at a minimum fee of $50.00. Please ensure you’ve packed all your belongings before checking out, as we cannot be responsible for items left. A $15.00 COD fee will apply for any items returned to you following your tenancy. Call our office for arrangements within 7 days after your departure, otherwise left items will be disposed. 
-We do not allow pets unless prior arrangements are made (registered service animals excepted). The Tenant will be responsible for cleaning after the animals inside and outside the cabin. 
-The Tenant, guests and all the occupants of the vacation home agrees to release and indemnify the Owner from and against all claims for damages and/or personal injuries to any person arising out of the use of subject premises, including interior and all exterior areas, including decks, stairs and other common areas that occurred during the tenancy of the premises.  Tenant agrees to be responsible for any repairs necessary due to their negligence.  

Let me know if you need anything.  


Carolyn 
304-466-4444

primaryHost/about: My husband is a retired German Language professor and I am still loving my work as a school psychologist.   We travel, read, and grow wonderful flowers in our little piece of the world.    When not on Tallery Mountain, we keep returning to Saint Malo, France.  We love the food, the sea and the history there almost as much as the food, the mountains and the history here.   We are West Virginians, born and raised.  Company is always welcome.
sectionedDescription/description:
On Tallery Mountain in Summers County, WV, it's almost Heaven to just sit on the back porch and watch the sunset.

In the heart of white water rafting, curvy motorcycle roads and golf courses, comfortable quarters are guaranteed after a hike or a day of fishing on the Bluestone or New Rivers.   Within 90 minutes is the Blue Ridge Parkway, New River Bridge, Pipestem, Bluestone, Babcock and Hawks Nest State Parks, The Greenbrier Resort, Tamarack, and historic Lewisburg.

additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out please contact (304)-589-5789
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee per pet. We will send you a request for additional pet fees. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

sectionedDescription/description:
FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL ~ ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

Everything you need in one place!

Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?

If so, you have found the right place!

FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL ~ Bluewell

ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

Everything you need in one place!
Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?
If so, you have found the right place!

This rental has a queen bed in the bedroom. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests.

It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, new flooring, and more! This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator. We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of the full-sized closet with dressers in the bedroom. There is a Smart TV in the living room and the bedroom, with a DVD player at each TV to watch your favorite Red Box movies on.

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE Wi-Fi, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go down steps to get to this one-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

FREE on site parking is available at the property

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.

sectionedDescription/description:
Relax with the whole family at this Brand new Cabin.  A very peaceful place to stay. Sits on the Guyandotte River that's great for kayaking.   Very close to the Hatfield McCoy Bear Wallow trailhead.   Unload your ATV and hit the trail.  Restaurant on site and also very close to a car wash.  If you need a place to stay for the holidays while visiting family, this is the place for you!

We have 3 separate bedrooms.  In 2 of the bedrooms there are queen size bed.   In the other bedroom we have 2 full size beds.  We have 1 bathroom with a shower and a laundry area  a washer and dryer

I live just a few minutes from the cabin.  I’m easy to get in touch with should any problem occur

There's a Tudor's Biscuit World Restaurant on site.  Other restaurants nearby.  Also Chief Logan state park is just a couple of miles down the road.  There is a Carwash close by

Bearwallow is a fun trail. Small but worth a good ride. There is a hill climb on 35, a
Coal mine on 36, a Collapsed coal mine on 86.  83 is a fun,  but more technical trail that has a deep mud pit on it. 
27 has two decent mud holes right in the middle of a wide open area. 
28 is nothing but mud.

Nice fire pit with benches.  Please bring your own firewood.  Also have a corn  hole game on-site.

We do not permit any type of partying or loud music.


*We are also just a couple of of miles from chief Logan State Park.  In the month of December they have “Christmas in the Park” light display.  Best in the state! 

No smoking is permitted inside of cabin

name: House on 100 Dillion St. Hatfield McCoy Trail
photos/15/caption: Worlds Longest ATV Train Trestle! You will ride this to the Rockhouse Trail System.
sectionedDescription/access: There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located in the heart of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System

HMT Rentals has direct trail access, we are  located in downtown Man, WV, less than one mile  from the Rockhouse Trailhead of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.

Check-In to our unit, drop your trailer, unload your machines and ride your ATV, UTV or Motorcycle directly to one of the local businesses in the Town of Man. Businesses include (Gas, Food, Bar and Grill, Sporting Goods!!)

There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.

Ride your machine through town to access the Hatfield McCoy Trail. Access Rockhouse Trail, Devil Anse Trail and Buffalo Mountain Trail. Also, ride your machine into town to eat at one of our many restaurants.

Located in the heart of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System

HMT Rentals has direct trail access, we are  located in downtown Man, WV, less than one mile  from the Rockhouse Trailhead of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.

Check-In to our unit, drop your trailer, unload your machines and ride your ATV, UTV or Motorcycle directly to one of the local businesses in the Town of Man. Businesses include (Gas, Food, Bar and Grill, Sporting Goods!!)

sectionedDescription/description:
***NO PETS
Log cabin with gorgeous wood details w/ the “bear~essentials” 3 beds/1.5 baths. Upstairs is open loft area with king bed and full bathroom. Downstairs has 2 bedrooms, one with 2 twins and other with queen bed. Pull out couch in the living room with plenty of room for an air mattress. Outdoor grill and fire pit area. Ride your SxS/UTV to town & trailheads.

Cabin with loft bedroom and 2 other bedrooms with a pull out full size couch.

Access to whole cabin.

Town is a old coal mining town that allows riding SxS and UTV’s on public roads. Close to many trailheads.

Cabin is located in the ATV friendly town of Boissevain and 4 miles from Pocahontas (9 miles from the Town of Bluefield) with access to Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trail which connects to Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trails along with the Original Pocahontas Spearhead Trail.

name: Shiloh Place
primaryHost/about: Husband, Dad, Papaw, Pastor, Hunter, Fisherman, Biker, Outdoorsman.  Have lived in the Mountains of WV most of my life.  Been riding and hunting here for 50 years.  This is our twenty three acre family homestead since 1972.  Come enjoy the peace and serenity of Almost Heaven WV.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: No access to attached garage.
sectionedDescription/description:
Quiet, peaceful Horse Farm in the Mountains of West Virginia.

Plenty of open space. Enjoy the mountain air. Close to the new Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail.  Unload and you won’t have to haul your ATV/UTV again until you head home.  Many outlaw trails nearby. Right off Rt16.  

If you like riding curves on  motorcycles or sports cars we’re only 30 minutes from Back of the Dragon Visitors Center. 15 minutes to Berwind Lake. A great place to get away from it all!!

No access to attached garage.

Available for questions by phone text or email.

304-320-3627
Twboyd59@gmail.com

Close access to Hatfield McCoy trail.  Right off Rt 16. Enjoy Berwind Lake nearby.  Rural mountain valley setting.  Quiet peaceful place to unwind, relax, and get back to nature.

Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail is accessible within two miles of the property.  Once you unload you won’t need to haul again until you head home.  If you like curves and ride motorcycles Rt 16 is at the end of the driveway with Back of the dragon only 30 minutes away.

The garage is not included in rental. No smoking or pets allowed. Please remove shoes when inside.  Hi speed WiFi access.  Roku Streaming available.  Please leave money for any purchases.

There is absolutely no illegal drug use allowed of any sort.  If you are caught you will be asked to leave and the police will be called.  Sorry I even have to mention this but it’s the world we live in. One bad apple……….

name: McCoy Lodge @ Busted ATV Resort
primaryHost/about: Adventure seeking and nature lover!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported smoke or carbon monoxide detectors on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.
sectionedDescription/description:
#1 Hatfield McCoy Trails Lodging

       The Busted ATV Resort in beautiful Bramwell, West Virginia, is the place to stay! Less than a mile ride from Hatfield McCoy trail head leading into over three hundred miles of trails. We are about 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park look out deck is just one mile from out front door.

Welcome to the McCoy Lodge.  The fully furnished lodge gives you space and privacy. Located at the top of Busted ATV Resort drive makes you king of the hill. Surrounded by the woods and located just six hundred feet from the peak of Mt. Me. There is a coin operated ATV pressure wash and washer and dryer.


This season has been filled with some awesome good times with new and old friends attending. For those of you that Ride Dirty, Sleep Clean  - thank you!  With your continued support My great friend Rob and I will continue to build Busted A in way that's perfect for all our needs. God bless!
Pat

How to find us?
 We are Located in Bramwell on Hwy 52 just one mile north of Pinnacle Rock state park . Don't always trust your GPS using addresses in WV. Tell your maps app. to take 
  you to Busted ATV Resort.



If you see any problems within the home upon entry we must be notified with in two hours of your arrival.

You are NOT responsible for washing linens or making the beds.

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

Call or text anytime. 
386-2991121
386-5278881

About a half mile from the Pocahontas trail head located in beautiful Bramwell . From here you have access to over four hundred miles of Hatfield McCoy trails that include Pocahontas, Indian ridge, Pinnacle and Warrior trail systems. Want more? Just a short six mile ride will get you into the Virginia spearhead trails. Need even more trails? Hitch up the trailer and take a day trip further into coal county to find even more Hatfield McCoy trail systems.


Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a great price in-season months (April - October) is by winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to stay at Busted ATV Resort contact us first. We make several trips throughout the winter season and can discount your 3 night minim stay if it aligns with our schedule. 

The Busted ATV Resort, in beautiful Bramwell, West Virginia, is the place to stay! The remodeled historic 1880 Bramwell House and adjacent accommodations. , at the base of Mt. Me, offer spacious accommodations with plenty of easy access parking. About a half mile  ride from Hatfield McCoy trail head and 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park look out deck is just one mile from out front door.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #8 - The Colonel May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #8 - The Colonel May Room (Shared Bathroom)

The Colonel May room is dedicated to the youngest son of Andrew Jackson and Nelle May. Andrew named his son “Colonel” in hopes to pass along some of the luster and reputation of his own name. This room is fit for a Colonel and styled for one too. With all the furnishings being dark, rich mahogany, and walnut. A favorite talking piece of this room is the beautiful stone capped foot boards. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing.

additionalHouseRules: Please do not wear/use any fragranced personal products (perfumed body sprays, colognes, lotions, shampoos, etc). It can be a real problem for both host and other guests who are migraine-prone or health sensitive. Also very hard for housekeeping to remove from linens. I provide fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, shave cream, lotion, and soap and deodorant that you're MORE than welcome to use!  If you have any questions, just ask. And if you need any other non-fragranced items (detergent, etc) just ask. NOTE: If your stay is over a Saturday, checkout is 9 a.m. Sunday, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed. The rules about goats, gates to use, feeding goats, etc., vary with the seasons. Just ask me.

name: Goat Haven Extra Wheel Room
photos/2/caption: Half bath with toilet and sink
photos/4/caption: Raised sink in the half bath
photos/6/caption: A great day trip, and you can start anywhere along the route.
primaryHost/about:
Part of what made us want to be an Airbnb hosts is the wonderful hospitality we've known in our own travels.  As native Appalachians, my husband and I have a deep love for this region and its people and the tradition of hospitality.  We are both artists of sorts--I'm a freelance writer/reporter and he is a rock 'n roll keyboard player and works in the local school system. And we manage a herd of dairy goats, mostly LaMancha breed. All with names and personalities. Our place is about 15-20  minutes off off I-77. We're close to the notable "Back of the Dragon" motorcycle routes. And very close to some beautiful backroad bicycle routes. The scenery is beautiful all seasons of the year but especially the fall. We hope you'll visit!

 As for the goats, they are "the greatest entertainers and the greatest time wasters" as my dad used to say. He was a vet and built the house as a home and office. So it has a sort of historic/museum feel in certain sections. 

We don't guarantee food as part of our Airbnb listing,  but I love to cook and if I'm cooking, you're welcome to join us if you don't have other plans. 

Last but not least, we  love to know a little about our guests beforehand so PLEASE make sure you fill out the "Describe Yourself" questions under the Airbnb profile section to speed along the booking process.

Safe travels!
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to the piano/parlor room for relaxing. And the kitchen and dining areas cast shared space.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is one of my three listings. (Click my profile photo to see the other two.) This small roomis great if you're on a budget, and just need a place to lay your head for the night. It has a comfortable twin bed, a desk with tea and snack corner, and is right next to a bathroom. Please note it's only a half bath...it has a bidet toilet and sink but no shower. The bedroom gets south sun in the morning. (It also faces the road so you might hear some passing cars at night if you're a light sleeper)

Guests have access to the piano/parlor room for relaxing. And the kitchen and dining areas cast shared space.

I'm in and out of the shared spaces but your bed and bath are always private. I do enjoy interacting with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.

Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price and won't be collected when you arrive. Hope to see you soon!

name: Campside Cottage
photos/1/caption:
The kitchen is fully stocked with stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, dishes, glasses, pots, pans, electric skillet, baking sheets, coffee station (uses K-cups or drip coffee)
Provided:  Coffee (K-cups), Sugar, Salt, Pepper, Oil.
photos/2/caption: Other items provided:  Cooking utensils, silverware, dishtowels, dish detergent.
photos/5/caption: Couch pulls out to a double (memory foam)bed for young children.
photos/6/caption: Smart TV w/ Wifi for streaming your favorite shows/movies!
photos/12/caption: Travel sized soap, shampoo, conditioner provided.
photos/13/caption:
Front of the house. Entrance to Campside Cottage is to the right (upstairs). Entrance to The Lake House is to the left—at the back of the house. Separate parking for each unit. 
No access between units. 
Quiet hours are 10:00 pm-8:00 am.
photos/14/caption: Campside Cottage is the upstairs unit. Downstairs is The Lake House—a 2 bedroom/1 bath Airbnb rental.
photos/15/caption: The lockbox code will be sent to you, and you have to put in the code again to close it.
photos/16/caption: Fire pit and seating for Campside Cottage.
photos/17/caption: Plenty of parking (and close to the stairs). Camp Burson is across the road. Lake trails are easily accessed from Campside Cottage!
photos/19/caption: Hungry Mother State Park rents canoes, paddleboats, kayaks, paddleboards.
photos/23/caption: If you are a motorcycle enthusiast and want to try the Back of the Dragon, or just a short drive leads you to a scenic overlook of beautiful Rich Valley, but no worries…this is not the road you have to travel to get to Hungry Mother!
photos/25/caption: Scenic Overlook-4.5 miles from Campside Cottage.
primaryHost/about: Welcome! We are glad to host you during your stay at Hungry Mother State Park!
sectionedDescription/access:
Access to the lake trail is located directly across from the property. The Clyburn trail is adjacent to the property. 

In addition to the hiking and biking trails of Hungry Mother Park, there is a beach area (with concessions), a gift shop (inside the park and at Camp Burson), playground areas, canoe, paddle boat, kayak, and paddle board rentals.
sectionedDescription/description:
Campside Cottage--a vacation retreat located across from Camp Burson at the entrance of Hungry Mother State Park in Marion, Virginia.  Relax around the campfire,  hike or bike the many trails.  Lounge on the beach with a good book, or cast your line to catch a big one!  Enjoy the beautiful views of the Appalachian mountains while paddleboarding or kayaking Hungry Mother Lake.  Don't forget to go shopping or sample the restaurants of America's Coolest Hometown!  Enjoy your stay!

Campside Cottage is a clean, newly- renovated modern farmhouse style retreat. It is an upstairs unit with a separate entrance (the downstairs is also a vacation rental with a separate entrance located at the opposite end of the house). There is a very large backyard (field) that kids can play in, and the driveway is perfect for bike riding. There is plenty of parking and you can enjoy the flicker of campfires from the campground across the road while having your own large, private area to yourself. There is a fire pit and outdoor seating area, plus a grill (both gas and charcoal provided) for outdoor cooking. The Campside Cottage is perfect for the couple looking to get away for a few days, or for the young family with small children.  Parents and guests of Emory & Henry Health Sciences students--we are located 2 miles from the Marion campus and would love to host you when you visit!

Access to the lake trail is located directly across from the property. The Clyburn trail is adjacent to the property. 

In addition to the hiking and biking trails of Hungry Mother Park, there is a beach area (with concessions), a gift shop (inside the park and at Camp Burson), playground areas, canoe, paddle boat, kayak, and paddle board rentals.

Guests will have complete privacy with self check-in. A lockbox allows flexibility for guests’ arrival times. A code will be sent to you prior to check-in. There is a list of instructions located within the cottage regarding check-out. Host phone numbers are located inside the rental. 

Message me on the Airbnb app or text/call me if there are any issues or anything that you need help with. I will respond promptly in order to ensure that you to have the best stay possible!!!

Check out the online Guidebook!

Campside Cottage is located at the entrance to Hungry Mother State Park, directly across from Camp Burson campground. Situated on 3.5 acres, there is plenty of privacy. Also, located on the property is the downstairs of this unit (also a vacation rental) as well as two additional vacation rentals (The Berry Cabin and Dreamer’s Lodge). Our property (@ the lake) ends at the fence at the back of the 3.5 acres. Beyond this fence is our neighbors…please respect their privacy! :)

Plenty of parking on site. The neighborhood is very quiet and very safe.

Downtown Marion has many excellent restaurants (Mi Puerto, Macados, Wooden Pickle, Moondog, Sisters’ Cafe & Gifts, Sur 81 to name a few, as well as many fast-food chains) and shopping (Blue Ridge Outfitters, Marion Outdoors, Army/Navy Store, Just Believe Boutique, The Daisy Boutique, Willbeez Country Store and Deli, The Toy Box and others). 

Take in a movie, or a game of putt-putt at Park Place Drive-In. Grab an ice-cream at Park Place or some fudge at Willbeez Country Store and Deli. Enjoy a cup of coffee or some pastry at Better Coffee Co. or Starbucks. 


Marion’s own Lincoln Theatre, one of the last remaining Mayan Revival style theaters in the world, provides a variety of performing arts events. 

And just a short drive away…Barter Theatre, Wohlfahrt Haus Dinner Theatre, Grayson Highlands Park, The Virginia Creeper Trail, Bristol Raceway, Pinnacle Shopping Center, The Back of the Dragon, the Appalachian Trail.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Load and start the dishwasher. Put dirty towels in the washer. Take trash out. Return remotes to their spot. Check drawers for leftover items. Set heat to 65 or air to 75. Make sure the stove is off and doors are locked. Thank you!

sectionedDescription/access:

Just outside Gilbert town limits.
sectionedDescription/description:
The River Lodge, where you can enjoy the Hatfield and McCoy trails, then relax on the porch or by the firepit in the back yard while listening to the river run in the background. 
Very spacious, close to town of GIlbert, relaxing.

Entire house, 3 bedroom 5 bed, 1 sleeper sofa. 2 full baths. Furnished kitchen.

Parking in drive way and yard at house.
Just outside Gilbert town limits.

House has covered back porch, garage with door for parking ATV’s, grill, fire pit and beautiful view of the river.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #7 - The Nelle May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #7 - The Nelle May Room (Shared Bathroom)

A room just as stunning as Andrew Jackson May’s second wife (who was 51 years his junior), the Nelle May room is a picturesque part of the mansion and is quickly becoming a guest favorite for it’s good vibes, early morning sunshine, happy wall coloring and vintage white painted bed. This expansive, bright, and cheerful bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace and also has a cozy sitting area. It is a perfect room for folks looking for a recharging environment.

name: Main Lodge @ Busted Atv Resort
photos/5/caption: RZR room - King with twin bunk bonus room
photos/13/caption: Look Out at Pinnacle Rock State Park - just 1 mile away and viewed from Busted Atv Resort
primaryHost/about: Adventure seeking and nature lover!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
The Main Lodge is only rented to one group at a time. Only Your group will be inhabiting the house during your stay.  Our beautiful 5 bed room, 2 bath + bonus room with lounge is # 1 in Hatfield McCoy lodging. Visit our social media pages for a video walk through and keep up with the latest up dates to the  Busted Atv Resort  2000+ square foot Main Lodge. Holiday weekends are three night minimum.

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.
sectionedDescription/description:
Ride dirty, Sleep clean! Busted ATV Resort offers you the very best in accommodations to ride the Hatfield McCoy trails.

The remodeled historic 1880 Bramwell House and adjacent  accommodations at the base of Mt. Me offer spacious accommodations with parking. Just a mile from Hatfield McCoy trail head and 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park and  Look Out is just one mile from our front door.

The Main Lodge is only rented to one group at a time. Only Your group will be inhabiting the house during your stay.  Our beautiful 5 bed room, 2 bath + bonus room with lounge is # 1 in Hatfield McCoy lodging. Visit our social media pages for a video walk through and keep up with the latest up dates to the  Busted Atv Resort  2000+ square foot Main Lodge. Holiday weekends are three night minimum.

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

Please feel free to call or text anytime.

The Busted ATV Resort is owned and operated by ATV nuts, for ATV nuts. Offering you the comforts of home including everything you need for the perfect stay.
 
Main lodge -Central heat and air, ceiling fans, wifi, smart streaming Tv's, large front porch, plenty of parking for your ATVs and Trailers, outdoor boot wash station,  Turbo Master Boot Dryer, laundry and more.

Winter Rates (November  13th - March 18th) are special accommodations that you must first contact us for availability and pricing before booking will be accepted . 

Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a Great Price In-season months (April - October)is by Winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to use the Resort contact us first. We require a 90 day notice on Bookings from mid November to Mid March.   Don't forget to follow us online for the latest info on Busted.

Separate little driveway runs right up to the cottage.

sectionedDescription/description:
Relax with the whole family on this peaceful working farm. Enjoy the farm animals and running stream in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains. Tour  the Blue Ridge Parkway or Creeper Trail.   Historic Wythe County, Wohlfahrt Theatre, Abingdon, Barter Theatre, Big Walker Lookout  Shot Tower, Draper Mercantile and so much more. Get unplugged, no distracting internet. Fish in the pond or make smores at the firepit.  Experience the farm with optional homegrown meals/tours. A little piece of heaven.

Beautiful renovated old cottage.

Separate little driveway runs right up to the cottage.
Enjoy sitting out on the upstairs balcony.

Located in Wythe Country, Southwest Virginia. Quiet, peaceful neighborhood, yet close enough to stores, restaurants. Lots of sightseeing and places to tour.
Fish right here in the pond on our farm
Bike, hike or swim.

Easy to explore and travel around by car.
Lots of local hiking and biking trails.
Also rivers for canoeing, tubing, swimming, fishing, etc.

Wonderful fishing in the pond. Catch and release.
Firepit with wood provided.
Beautiful views.
Option to book a mini photo shoot here at the farm during your stay.

primaryHost/about: I am a pharmacist from rural Appalachian Virginia. Married with 2 adult children with whom I enjoy traveling the world whenever possible.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom apartment in Cedar Bluff Virginia town limits. Sleeps 4-5. Friendly community. Tranquil setting in a rural town with a creek flowing nearby. 5 min to Richlands. 10 min from the local hospital, Clinch Valley Medical Center. 20 min to Tazewell. 15 min to the Dragon's Back. 75 min to Bristol Motor Speedway. Multiple 4-wheeler trails nearby. Local trout streams 30 minutes in any direction. Washer/Dryer access. Free coffee, and WiFi. Private 2nd-floor entrance via outdoor stairs.

Grocery stores and pharmacies are conveniently located only 6 minutes away. Only 1 mile from the Blue Tornadoes Football field. If you happen to be a football fan you can find the whole town at Richlands High School on Friday nights during the fall.

The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.

Available by phone. We live locally so are available in the event of an emergency.

Enjoy gorgeous foliage and a breathtaking view at Cedar Bluff Overlook. It is about a 30-minute hike on a marked trail. Enjoy scenic drives through the Clinch Mountains, East River Mountains, and the Appalachian Mountains all around the area.
The Cedar Bluff Heritage Festival occurs annually on the third Saturday of September. You will find antique dealers and food vendors among many other activities. The festival attracts thousands of visitors and hundreds of vendors each year.  OKTOBREWFEST is a festival that is held on beautiful historic Main St. Tazewell, VA the first Saturday of October and was created to promote the craft beer industry in southwest VA and the surrounding area. It is the Premier Craft Beer Festival of the Heart of Appalachia.  There are several local restaurants of note, Cuz’s restaurant has been named the best in off-the-beaten-track restaurant categories. Bearded Moose is a frequented local barbecue restaurant loved by locals, and you can enjoy a sweet treat at Sugarfoot Bakery only 6 minutes away. Painted Peak Brewing Company is approximately 25 minutes away from the apartment where you can sample local brews. Multiple hiking trails and 4 wheeler trails are options for your entertainment. Kayaking and canoeing are available at local lakes and rivers. Enjoy Crab Orchard Museum located about 15 minutes away to learn more about the history in our area.
The apartment is located approximately 30 min from the Appalachian College of Pharmacy and approximately 13 minutes from Southwest Community College. Raven Theater is a historic site located about 10 minutes away. Limited show-times and hours, but when they are open it is a special stop for soda fountain ice cream.  Broadway Cinemas is the local contemporary theater located about 6 minutes away.

The town of Cedar Bluff has sidewalks with lights and you can enjoy a leisurely afternoon stroll. 4 County Transit offers public transportation. Town route fare is 25¢ per boarding.
Work express fare is 50¢ per boarding.
College routes are public routes and open to anyone who wants to ride. Fare for public riders is $1.00 per boarding.
College route fare is FREE for college students and staff/faculty who present college ID, seniors at least 60 years old, and children 5 or younger who are accompanied by an adult.
At your request, the bus can stop at other locations that are along its route. This is a route deviation service. 
Please call at least 48 hours in advance with your requests. 
Check out their website for additional information.

additionalHouseRules:
Quiet time is between 10pm and 7am.
Cabin should be left in a clean manner. Excessively dirty cabins will be subject to additional cleaning fee. 
Please unload and park all atv's on the gravel at all times.
Absolutely no smoking inside cabins. If smoking is suspected you will be subject to a $150 fee to cover cleaning and deodorizing of cabin.
No grilling or cooking of any kind allowed on porches.
No illegal drugs of any kind allowed on property at any time.  allowed
Pets must be registered guests and under 30 lbs. Pets must be on leash at all  times outside. They must go with you on the trails or be crated in the cabin. Guests who leave dogs who bark constantly may be asked to leave with no refund.
Children must remain under adult supervision at all times.
Please place garbage in dumpster and wash your dishes before you leave. Also, please strip your beds linens and place in a pile somewhere in the cabin. Please place all used towels in a pile.
Cancellation Policy: We have a 30 day cancellation policy per cabin. If reservations are cancelled at least 30 days prior to your reservation date then a full refund will be given. If less than 30 days, then there will be no refund of your deposit unless we are able to rent the cabin(s) by the dates you originally reserved.  All cancellations will be charged $50 per cabin regardless of notification date. There will be no refunds for early departure.  If you have any further questions the just let us know.

photos/0/caption: Riverfront cabin with a queen bed in the master, two twins in the loft and a sofa sleeper in the great room. The cabin has vaulted ceilings throughout, full bath, front porch swing, fire ring, and park like charcoal grill.
photos/1/caption: Kitchen offers hickory cabinets and full size stainless sink. All utensils are included as well as pots and pans. There is a coffee maker, microwave, toaster, full size fridge, and a cooktop.
photos/2/caption: The loft space offers two twin size beds with a large window facing the river.
photos/3/caption: The bedroom offers a comfy queen size bed.
primaryHost/about: We have been in the cabin rental business on the Hatfield McCoy Trails since October of 2007. Our guests are always satisfied and are usually return visitors.

sectionedDescription/description:
Wildwood Cabins sits right on the Guyandotte River and the views are amazing and peaceful. We are only 250 yards from trail 17 of the RockhousTrail and only five minutes from the grocery store, restaurants, and gas stations in downtown Gilbert. We can leave trail permits and maps in the cabin for you so there's no need to worry about running those down. Our cabins are very well kept and clean.

We live on property and are available if you need us.

name: The Armstrong Lodging
sectionedDescription/description:
Newly opened in downtown Pinevile, WV. Each room has different scene. Cool gel beds with all white comforters,
patagonon rosewood floors, granite counter tops, and top of the line accessories.  Drinks, snacks and desserts included in price of rooms. Lots of free parking. Easy access. Close to the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.  Quiet and friendly town. Nice view of the historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Pinnacle Rock.

FREE WiFi, phones., parking. Easy Access. Handicap accessible
Free softdrinks, snacks and desserts. Feel right at home, if you get hungry, go to kitchen area and get a snack or pop some popcorn with softdrinks. Situated downtown Pineville, very quiet and friendly town. View of historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Castle Rock. With 2 miles of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System. Plenty of parking for four wheelers and trailers.

On site employee til 9:00 p.m. and after hours emergency phone numbers provided. Maid service every day.

The Town of Pineville is very quiet and friendly town.  We have a
beautiful historical CourtHouse and a rock formation known as
Castle Rock. Pineville has access to the Hatfield McCoy Trail Head with 2 miles of town and four wheelers are allowed on the streets.  We have several restuarants to choose from. We are located downtown Pineville on Main Street.

Pineville has a park within walking distance, can hike Castle Rock and four wheelers and dirt bikes are allowed on the streets to get to the Hatfield McCoy Trails. No public transit is available. Host will be glad to take you where you need to go.

name: Relaxation near the Edge of the Woods
photos/8/caption: Driveway entrance to Back of house
primaryHost/about:
This is the home we grew up in a small town in southern WV with our parents and grandparents living across the road.  Our family wants to keep our childhood home that holds many memories of grandparents, friends, family, and neighbors as well as our children who grew to love the area.  That was the deciding decision for hosting the airbnb with brothers - Jamie and Troy with help from everyone else.

I am a retired art teacher from Taylor County WV and Lexington Senior High NC. I live in Thomasville NC with my husband who is also from McDowell County WV.  Besides art, I sew and have an online etsy shop.  My brother Troy, has a house-painting business and lives near Bluefield Va.  Our sister Ann, retired from teaching music and her husband have lived in many areas; they are now retired living in White Sulphur Springs WV.  Jamie, my youngest sibling, is a visual artist and works with Urban Tree in Pittsburgh Pa (unique wood furniture).
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music
sectionedDescription/description:
-Enjoy country living with plenty of privacy and nature around you in southern WV
 -Artists, Writers, Nature/ ATV enthusiasts -hike -outlaw trails connect to Warrior Trail within 4 miles
-Close to: Berwind Lake, Lincolnshire Park, close to Head & Back of the Dragon
-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie

- very private location, woods are out back
- main entrance is to the right of the home; code will be sent for the lockbox - we always used the kitchen entrance
- all-purpose room (unheated) has a large table, lots of windows, and is great for crafting, art projects,  games, etc
- Artists/Photographers -lots of nature for inspiration -  the all-purpose room is surrounded by windows and has a large table for a workspace
- Writers - quiet and private
- large outdoor area with basketball hoop, a pond near the fire pit - pond has been low this year;  plenty of wood down - bring your axe if you want to chop more
- 2 carports -  at the lower parking and in back of the house; 
- Fully equipped kitchen, coffee bar set up on buffet - stocked coffee, filters, and tea bags - keurig is available so bring your favorite flavors
- kitchen towels, detergents will be provided 
- bath has soaps, body wash, hand sanitizers, first aid supplies
- two bedrooms specifically, third bedroom was the den that has a daybed and floor space to set up an air mattress, could also be used as a playroom or an office space; there is one locked room for owner storage
- bring sheets, wash cloths, and bath towels
- plenty of bed pillows to choose from; blankets available for use yet you may choose to bring your own bedding
- 'alexa' echo dot in kitchen, lamp on the dresser in the first bedroom is plugged into a smart plug, identified as smart plug 2, should we forget to deactivate while you're there
-Security cameras recently installed (Feb 2023) - we will deactivate while you are a guest 
- large yard and lot;  beautiful daylilies lined the driveway, the white azalea was in full-bloom this spring as well as the irises
- well-water - water softener is used, filter is on the kitchen faucet and a filtered pitcher if you want double-filtered water
-outdoor water pump if you need but please do not leave a muddy yard - there's also a utility sink in the basement that guests may use -for vehicles, there's a car wash (still $1) at the bottom of the road across the RR tracks and bridge
- people are friendly here - check out the local eats (left a list in the guest book)
- 18 acres - rough trails can be hiked but we recommend you carry a walking stick, use bug spray (ticks included), and look out for wildlife; we recently marked a short trail with white paint on the trees, more to come later
-Phones - set up before you arrive to use your internet phone # at the house but you will get cell phone service as you drive within a few miles; house phone can be used for local calls, for your loved ones to call in, or emergencies
- Outlaw trails nearby (there's a rough road trail you could ride above our land if you drive past our house approximately 1/4 mile, it was used by the mining company), approximately 4 miles to Cucumber (Big Creek Mountain Road) is an outlaw trail that will connect to the Warrior trail
- Ol Country Store in Newhall (approximately 3 miles) is an ATV registration station and helpful with info and directions
- ATVs ride on the roads and as long as there's no issues, police allow it
-  Head of the Dragon passes by our home
-   Back of the Dragon is less than 25 minutes in Tazewell, Va


- By booking this home, you are in agreement to the following: 
 
      People	other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.

     This home is privately owned, the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  Be aware of safety precautions -  there is a pond and a covered opening to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

     The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the Guest or any person with the Guest.

     By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

      Renter agrees that any liability assigned by any court of law shall be limited to the amount of the rental contract.

If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music

There is a local contact name (Cindy) on the buffet should guests need anything immediately or call me and I will contact her.

Private setting with the woods behind you and beside you.  Pond on the lower lot with the fire pit.  One neighbor across the street.

The Warrior Trail is 10 miles from our house, parking is at the Trailhead office through the town of War (about another mile from the trail entrance.  The outlaw trails do not show up on the trail maps, we drew one to leave at the house for New Haven Road (hopefully the last riders left it). The other access is below Cucumber and called Big Creek Mountain Road. New Haven Rd is around 4 miles from our lodge, maybe 1/4 from the store and Big Creek Mountain Rd is another couple miles.  I've been told this is the map that will show you all trails...search bob t maps

Rt 16  will lead you to:
Left turn:
- Ol Country Store in Newhall where you can get food, permits and maps
- access to one of the trails past Brewster's Oil 
- Restaurants and stores in War, WV (southern most WV city)
- Welch WV - art/historical center, movie theater
Right turn:
- Bishop Hillbilly Mart - food, gas
- Adria - gas, food
- Tazewell Va - grocery stores - Grants, FoodLion; 
       Parks - Lincolnshire, Cavitt's Creek, Lake Witten;
       Back of the Dragon 
       Local shops:  Between Friends; Silk Bloomers, consignment shops

Rt 11 is Canebrake Mountain Road - turn left for a country drive to Berwind Lakes

---Guests will be provided blankets/quilts, pillows, and kitchen towels.  Guests will provide their own sheets and bath towels.  Dish detergent, hand soaps, paper towels, bathroom tissue, and hand sanitizer are provided.
---its actually a 3BR home but one is presently locked for family storage and the den has an accordion door to give privacy as a 3rd bedroom
---Plenty of downed wood to be found for the firepit, might want to bring an ax or saw
---Hunters - if you’re coming during hunting seasons - there are 2 gun racks on the walls for your convenience
---Den area:  - there’s a daybed that sleeps one, a monitor that could be used with your device; there’s a few books and games
---The sofas both have pull-out beds, the love seat is more comfortable than the full but kids don't seem to notice.  The queen air mattress does fit in the den floor on the desk side
---Great views for artists and the all-purpose room would be a great place for painting - lots of windows
---Writers would enjoy the pace and quiet
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
-Up to 2 pets allowed upon owner approval 
-No pets on the furniture/ pets must be in a crate when away from the home
- guess provide sheets and bath towels- pillows blankets and covers are provided as well as kitchen towels
-Run dishwasher/hand wash all dishes/ put away before check-out
-Bag and Take all trash to the outdoor trash can/ secure with bungee before check-out (Tues pickup)
-Use ashtray if smoking outdoors - please do not litter cigarette butts
 NO SMOKING inside
-Shoe tray available by the door- please do not wear muddy shoes inside
-Outdoor water pump available but do not leave a muddy yard
- Basement is used as storage and utilities of owners; guest access for use of utility sink only - use outside door only
- Closet in the twin bedroom is locked for family storage
- Internet cannot be used for illegal purposes or to transmit illegal materials
- Extra outdoor camp chairs available in the all-purpose room - feel free to use and return before leaving
- The use, possession, or manufacture of illegal drugs is prohibited on premises.
- There is a pond and a firepit on the lower lot; be aware and cautious of falling on uneven ground
- People other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in or on the property; Group parties are not permitted
- This is a privately owned property, guests are responsible for any injuries or damage while on the property
- Parking is available on the carports and in the gravel areas except- do not block the entrance
- See the Guest check-out list on the refrigerator and read the Security Deposit criteria 
-The owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  
-  there is a pond and a covered access to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

sectionedDescription/space:
- very private location, woods are out back
- main entrance is to the right of the home; code will be sent for the lockbox - we always used the kitchen entrance
- all-purpose room (unheated) has a large table, lots of windows, and is great for crafting, art projects,  games, etc
- Artists/Photographers -lots of nature for inspiration -  the all-purpose room is surrounded by windows and has a large table for a workspace
- Writers - quiet and private
- large outdoor area with basketball hoop, a pond near the fire pit - pond has been low this year;  plenty of wood down - bring your axe if you want to chop more
- 2 carports -  at the lower parking and in back of the house; 
- Fully equipped kitchen, coffee bar set up on buffet - stocked coffee, filters, and tea bags - keurig is available so bring your favorite flavors
- kitchen towels, detergents will be provided 
- bath has soaps, body wash, hand sanitizers, first aid supplies
- two bedrooms specifically, third bedroom was the den that has a daybed and floor space to set up an air mattress, could also be used as a playroom or an office space; there is one locked room for owner storage
- bring sheets, wash cloths, and bath towels
- plenty of bed pillows to choose from; blankets available for use yet you may choose to bring your own bedding
- 'alexa' echo dot in kitchen, lamp on the dresser in the first bedroom is plugged into a smart plug, identified as smart plug 2, should we forget to deactivate while you're there
-Security cameras recently installed (Feb 2023) - we will deactivate while you are a guest 
- large yard and lot;  beautiful daylilies lined the driveway, the white azalea was in full-bloom this spring as well as the irises
- well-water - water softener is used, filter is on the kitchen faucet and a filtered pitcher if you want double-filtered water
-outdoor water pump if you need but please do not leave a muddy yard - there's also a utility sink in the basement that guests may use -for vehicles, there's a car wash (still $1) at the bottom of the road across the RR tracks and bridge
- people are friendly here - check out the local eats (left a list in the guest book)
- 18 acres - rough trails can be hiked but we recommend you carry a walking stick, use bug spray (ticks included), and look out for wildlife; we recently marked a short trail with white paint on the trees, more to come later
-Phones - set up before you arrive to use your internet phone # at the house but you will get cell phone service as you drive within a few miles; house phone can be used for local calls, for your loved ones to call in, or emergencies
- Outlaw trails nearby (there's a rough road trail you could ride above our land if you drive past our house approximately 1/4 mile, it was used by the mining company), approximately 4 miles to Cucumber (Big Creek Mountain Road) is an outlaw trail that will connect to the Warrior trail
- Ol Country Store in Newhall (approximately 3 miles) is an ATV registration station and helpful with info and directions
- ATVs ride on the roads and as long as there's no issues, police allow it
-  Head of the Dragon passes by our home
-   Back of the Dragon is less than 25 minutes in Tazewell, Va


- By booking this home, you are in agreement to the following: 
 
      People	other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.

     This home is privately owned, the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  Be aware of safety precautions -  there is a pond and a covered opening to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

     The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the Guest or any person with the Guest.

     By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

      Renter agrees that any liability assigned by any court of law shall be limited to the amount of the rental contract.
sectionedDescription/summary:
-Enjoy country living with plenty of privacy and nature around you in southern WV
 -Artists, Writers, Nature/ ATV enthusiasts -hike -outlaw trails connect to Warrior Trail within 4 miles
-Close to: Berwind Lake, Lincolnshire Park, close to Head & Back of the Dragon
-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie
