additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

name: Miners Den
photos/20/caption: Front of FWH toward Miners Den
primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br ADA unit is TRAILSIDE to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trails & Visitors Center at Coaldale, WV. Direct access to Pocahontas Spearhead Trail in VA. and to all Southern HMT Trails in WV, over 500 mi. On Rt 52 just 13 miles from I-77 exit 1.

Experience rustic charm with all the amenities of home in Four Wheeler Heaven's newest unit, The Miners Den! This two bedroom, one bathroom unit sleeps 6-8 people and is wheelchair accessible. When you walk in, you'll be greeted by rustic decor and historical photos from Mercer, McDowell and Tazewell counties, including photos of coal miners from our own family. The large living room TV and complimentary Wi-Fi provide plenty of entertainment after a long day's ride.

The Miners Den comes fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot — basically everything you need to get started. You can cook for your whole group with a full kitchen, including an oven/stove, microwave, full-size refrigerator/freezer, dishwasher, coffeemaker and crockpot. The Miners Den also has its own washer/dryer unit. Trust us - you'll need it after a day on the trails!

An oversized bathroom with an ADA accessible toilet and shower provides easy access to persons with disabilities. The master bedroom features a queen bed, closet, and its own private HD TV. The second bedroom is a bunk room with four Twin XL beds - perfect for the kids or other members of your group. The Miners Den also has a roll-out bed in the living room couch that can sleep up to 2 additional people, for a total capacity of 8.

There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers so you can be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. The bunk room shares a lock-out door with the Coaldale Condo, our original two bedroom, one bathroom unit that sleeps up to 5 people. Groups that rent both the Miners Den and Coaldale Condo will have a total of four bedrooms and two bathrooms with a capacity of 13 people. 

Ride all four southern Hatfield-McCoy trails: Pocahontas, Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior. The Spearhead "Original Pocahontas" trail is a quick 4-mile ride up and over Coaldale Mountain Road. We also have a handy machine wash area on property and offer trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, FWH T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Ride your ATV or UTV right from our location to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trailhead just 100 yards away!

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.
sectionedDescription/space:
Experience rustic charm with all the amenities of home in Four Wheeler Heaven's newest unit, The Miners Den! This two bedroom, one bathroom unit sleeps 6-8 people and is wheelchair accessible. When you walk in, you'll be greeted by rustic decor and historical photos from Mercer, McDowell and Tazewell counties, including photos of coal miners from our own family. The large living room TV and complimentary Wi-Fi provide plenty of entertainment after a long day's ride.

The Miners Den comes fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot — basically everything you need to get started. You can cook for your whole group with a full kitchen, including an oven/stove, microwave, full-size refrigerator/freezer, dishwasher, coffeemaker and crockpot. The Miners Den also has its own washer/dryer unit. Trust us - you'll need it after a day on the trails!

An oversized bathroom with an ADA accessible toilet and shower provides easy access to persons with disabilities. The master bedroom features a queen bed, closet, and its own private HD TV. The second bedroom is a bunk room with four Twin XL beds - perfect for the kids or other members of your group. The Miners Den also has a roll-out bed in the living room couch that can sleep up to 2 additional people, for a total capacity of 8.

There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers so you can be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. The bunk room shares a lock-out door with the Coaldale Condo, our original two bedroom, one bathroom unit that sleeps up to 5 people. Groups that rent both the Miners Den and Coaldale Condo will have a total of four bedrooms and two bathrooms with a capacity of 13 people. 

Ride all four southern Hatfield-McCoy trails: Pocahontas, Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior. The Spearhead "Original Pocahontas" trail is a quick 4-mile ride up and over Coaldale Mountain Road. We also have a handy machine wash area on property and offer trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, FWH T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.
sectionedDescription/summary: This 2br ADA unit is TRAILSIDE to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trails & Visitors Center at Coaldale, WV. Direct access to Pocahontas Spearhead Trail in VA. and to all Southern HMT Trails in WV, over 500 mi. On Rt 52 just 13 miles from I-77 exit 1.
sectionedDescription/transit: Ride your ATV or UTV right from our location to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trailhead just 100 yards away!

name: Whispering Pines Private Cabin 5 mins off I-77
primaryHost/about: We are a nature loving and hard working family. We came to Bland several years ago for the beauty and private way of living. Walkers Valley is one of the most beautiful places you will ever see. Serenity, peacefulness, and the beauty of the mountains, are all the reasons we moved here.  We invite you, our guests, to come and see for yourself. We promise, if you love the outdoors as much as we do, you will be able to appreciate the beauty of Bland, Va.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enchanted cozy cabin " Whispering Pines " located 5 minutes off I-77 in Bland, Va.  Our cabin is  located on 8 acres of property and full  of various types of wildlife.  Sometimes, you will see bear, deer, wild turkey, and squirrels. We also live on the property, but the cabin is private and  tucked away within the beautiful whispering pines.

. The interior has recently been updated with appliances and decor including farmhouse style. The exterior of the cabin has also been recently renovated. There is a  peaceful fire pit for your family to enjoy.  You will need an All Wheel Drive (AWD) or Four -Wheel Drive vehicle (4x4) in order to drive all the way to the cabin because the incline is a little steep for a 2 wheel drive. There  is a parking lot at the top of this incline for all the Non-AWD and Non-4x4 vehicles.  Please note, you will only have to walk approximately 75 yards down the hill to the cabin. The other Parking lot is at the bottom. Upon request, a pack & play can be provided for your baby or toddler. The cabin is NOT wheelchair accessible and has NO WIFI! Cell service is limited to Verizon, however AT&T will pick up 1 bar and LTE. The cabin has No cable TV; however, there is a 42 inch TV available with multi-selection DVDs for adults and children.  We have also included a selection of books for adults and children. Our property has 2 ponds,  a mid-sized refrigerator, sink, dishes, pots/pans,  silverware, cooking utensils, and a Keurig coffee pot. Enjoy your evening sitting by the firepit or gazebo by the pond. Although, our water source is from freshwater springs, we do advise not to drink, to be on the safe side; however you can boil the water for drinking and cooking. We will provide each guest with one bottle of drinking water.  Whispering Pines cabin is sparkling clean and  very quiet with a peaceful rustic setting.

Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.

Available by cell phone.

This cabin is nestled in the Blue Ridge mountains surrounded by the Washington Jefferson National Forest. There are many Appalachian trail heads  in Bland county and  many things to do nearby. The closest Appalachian trailhead from the cabin is only 2.1 miles. Fort Chiswell Animal Park(16 miles), Wytheville (11 miles), Dismal Falls Retreat (14 miles), Wolf Creek Indian village and Museum (5.3 miles), Big Walker Lookout (10.6 miles), Dollar General (2.1 miles), Grants supermarket (1.8 miles), and some of the best sandwiches, cheeses, furniture, and Amish hospitality around,  Walkers Valley Market(16 miles).

24 hours before your arrival I will provide you a Key Code for the Lock Box.

primaryHost/about: Happily married. Love the outdoors and traveling, renovation and design, woodworking and gardening.
sectionedDescription/access: Entire home, large secured garage for ATVs and SxSs, and patio deck in back. Exterior parking for tow vehicle and trailer.
sectionedDescription/description:
Close to trailheads, to the welcome center,  to restaurants, grocery stores, car wash, ATV parts store and pharmacies. Two queen beds with top of the line mattresses.  1.5 bathrooms, heated toilet seat, kitchen, living room, a mudroom a private outdoor patio with grill. Elaborate coffee station, Wi-Fi, Roku TV, charging stations, and large, secure garage for your machines. Outdoor security cameras for your and your vehicle's protection. Park your tow vehicle and ride your whole stay!

ATV's Welcome throughout our small town. You can ride from Adventurer's Rest to the trails, restaurants, the car wash, and the grocery store. Every room you walk into provides a new experience. Rest after the adventures of the day. Relax and enjoy the stay as much as the you enjoy the adventure itself.

High end finishes, bluetooth speaker light fixture, Roku TV, multiple charging stations, heated toilet seat with LED lighting, lighted bathroom mirror, Induction cooktop, Rainfall/waterfall/body jet shower, heat lamps provide a spa-like/never cold shower experience. Exquisite flooring, Homedics soundspa for a peaceful sleep experience. Luxury towels and linens. Keurig Coffee maker with a varied selection of coffee and teas. Helpful and attentive hosts that are available during your stay. Our goal is that you enjoy your stay and will want to return again and again!

Entire home, large secured garage for ATVs and SxSs, and patio deck in back. Exterior parking for tow vehicle and trailer.

We live in the other home on the property and will give you as much privacy as you desire. We will be available by text for the duration of your stay should you need anything.

Quiet neighborhood, close to trailheads, restaurants, grocery stores, drug stores and more. ATVs and SxSs are welcome on our public streets with a helmet and insurance. In addition to the famous Hatfield/McCoy trail system and the Spearhead trails, we also have Exhibition Coal Mines, Wintergreen Ski Resort, Pinnacle Rock State and Pipestem State Parks and plenty of hiking and gorgeous mountain views nearby.

You can park your tow vehicle and ride the whole time you are here if you so desire.

Adventurer's Rest is not just a place to lay your head. Each room is an experience. Bedroom 1 has a ceiling light which is also a bluetooth speaker that can be controlled to change colors or show scenes, and can even be used as an alarm. 

Bedroom 2 has a sleepspa machine with your choice of noises to sleep to. 

The full bath has a heated toilet seat with a built in nightlight and a lighted mirror. It also has a rain shower with waterfall and body spray options. 

We offer a Roku TV with plenty of streaming capabilities.

And the design of every room with high end finishes is an experience in itself.

We ask that you respect the privacy of our family members and the respect the neighbors. ATV's are always welcome in our town but excessive revving of engines, etc should be reserved for the trails.

primaryHost/about: My husband and I live on the adjoining property.  Our cabin has a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere that includes free fishing in all the  ponds.  We are about  10 minutes away from several restaurants and gas stations.  We live close to areas that offer golf, whitewater rafting , trail riding, state parks ( New River Gorge )  and much more. We are  less than 10 min. away from beautiful Lake Stevens where you can enjoy your boat, kayaking, hiking , or the beach.  During the winter months we welcome guest who enjoy skiing and  tubing at Winter Place .

photos/0/caption: Proper queen-sized bed on the left and a queen-sized EZ Bed air mattress on the right. The air mattress can be added upon request.
sectionedDescription/access: Our guests may enjoy their suite, the patios, the kitchen and the upstairs full bathroom.
sectionedDescription/description:
A comfortable, large private suite in our home, that includes your own kitchenette, stocked with cold water and tea, private .5 bath in the suite and a private full bath on the second floor, HDTV and free WiFi. Located in a quiet neighborhood in Beckley, West Virginia. (50 min south of Charleston, WV, 4.5hrs from Washington DC, ). Snacks & coffee available.

 We look forward to seeing you!

There are two queen beds and couch in the room.

Our guests may enjoy their suite, the patios, the kitchen and the upstairs full bathroom.

I like to leave our guests to themselves to decompress from their journey and get some rest, but I will be around for any comments or to answer any questions you may have.

Someone is usually around the house, but if we are not home, then just text me.  -Sheila
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Respect our home as we will respect you. Enjoy your stay.

name: Warrior Trail: Love Shack Caretta 768: ATV lodging
photos/1/caption: Cozy Living Room with Queen Sleeper Sofa
photos/7/caption: nice dine-in kitchen for family meals
photos/14/caption: short drive to Warrior Trailhead; ATVs can be ridden on roads.
primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!
sectionedDescription/access: Full house access, basement with washer and dryer. back yard with grill, creek, walking bridge to explore
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom, 1 bath creekside house located within minutes of the newest Hatfield McCoy trailhead: the Warrior Trail. Surrounded by beautiful mountains, and Outlaw trails. Cozy living room and spacious dine-in kitchen. Plenty of parking for trucks, trailers, and ATVs makes this place ideal for outdoor adventurists.

2 Bedroom, 1 bath creekside house located within minutes of the newest Hatfield McCoy trailhead: the Warrior Trail. Surrounded by beautiful mountains, and Outlaw trails. Cozy living room and spacious dine-in kitchen. Plenty of parking for trucks, trailers, and ATVs makes this place ideal for outdoor adventurists.

Full house access, basement with washer and dryer. back yard with grill, creek, walking bridge to explore

We are available by phone or text almost anytime. We are often in the area, but live out of town.
We are glad to answer questions about local trails and attractions as well as easy directions to the house.

Our house is on a main road between War, WV, and Welch, WV. There are restaurants, gas stations, a beautiful lake area, and a movie theater all within 10-20 minutes. You can ride your ATV pretty much anywhere you want to go.

You can go almost anywhere by ATV.

Watch your step on exiting back door

Walking trails
sectionedDescription/description:
Sleeps up to 15 with additional space for air mattresses on 5 acres with two freshwater streams!  As of June 2020, we now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET. 
The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions.  Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

This 5 Bedroom with 2 full and 2 half bathroom home is located on 5 acres in beautiful southwestern Virginia.  
Easily found and accessible from Interstate 77 (13 miles) and Interstate 81 (40 miles).
First floor (main living floor) includes the kitchen, dining, den, laundry, ½ bath and master bed/bathrooms.
Second floor includes the living room, 3 bedrooms, 1 ½ bathrooms.
Third floor includes a finished room with 2 sets of bunk beds.
Other amenities include basic cable television, WIFI internet, washer/dryer and dish washer.
Outside you will find a large wrap around porch and large rear deck with great mountainous views.  A spacious yard with fire pit is bordered on two sides by separate freshwater streams that hold trout at certain times of the year.
We now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET

2 creeks 
Fire pit 
Walking trails

Available for all your questions phone, text or email.

The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions. Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

A wide driveway with egress from a paved county road (Rt. 61) provides entrance to the property and will accommodate multiple large pickup trucks pulling trailers (ATV’s, Horses, etc.) and will also allow excessive room for turn around.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please do not wear shoes in the house, No pets allowed due to allergies. 

No shooting guns on property

name: Wayne's Outlaw Retreat
sectionedDescription/access: We have plenty of parking on both sides of the house and in the backyard.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our home is located in the ATV friendly town of Mullens, with easy access to the  Pinnacle Creek trail which connects to Indian Ridge and Pocahontas with  plenty of Outlaw trails in between.  We are a family of riders, so we have made our place the perfect retreat for a families and riders alike.

Our place is very open, spacious, comfortable and most importantly clean. We have fast WIFI, a fully equipped kitchen, a stocked laundry room, a charcoal grill with seating outside, a fire ring, two smart TVs, and a jacuzzi tub in the master.

We have plenty of parking on both sides of the house and in the backyard.

Guest can always reach me by email at sebouch23@gmail.com

Quaint, quiet neighborhood.

We have plenty of parking at the home, ATV friendly town can ride to trails, gas, restaurants, groceries, and more.

primaryHost/about: Hi! I own 2 Airbnb loft apartments in downtown Tazewell, VA. It brings me great joy to host visitors here in beautiful T-Town. I work with coal impacted communities in Southwest VA on Economic Development projects. I can be your personal tourism assistant while you’re visiting Tazewell, just ask!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Full access to entire apartment and balcony.
sectionedDescription/description:
Conveniently located on Main Street Tazewell, you’re within walking distance to 3 full service downtown restaurants, a coffee shop, brewery, boutiques, an art gallery and more! Spacious apartment, featuring a king suite and a second bedroom with a full sized bed. Pull out the futon for additional sleepers, and there’s a full sized couch as well. Kitchen features new appliances and everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals during your stay. Laundry room with washer and dryer for your use.

Built in 1878, this building was the original home to Clinch Valley News. This second story apartment is overflowing with charm & character. Guests have access to a full living room, featuring a sofa, chair and smart TV. An 8 person dining table, full kitchen, bathroom, king suite with a futon and a smart TV, and a full size bed in the second bedroom with a walk in closet.

Full access to entire apartment and balcony.

I am a phone call or text away!

Main Street Tazewell is home to a variety of restaurants and retail shops and is the gateway to the scenic Back of the Dragon. Parking is located in the back of the building, we share a parking lot with the Sheriff’s Department and the Library. There is plenty of safe and private parking.

Parking and entrance to the apartment is located in the back of the building. Turn onto Marion Ave from Main Street and take the left hand turn into the parking lot. The entrance is the white door. You will be given an access code to unlock the door.

WiFi, off street parking, trash pick up, washer and dryer inside apartment.

name: Hazel's Place ATV Riders Hideaway
sectionedDescription/description:
Bring your family and friends to stay at Hazels Place while you're visiting the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.  Leave your trucks and trailers at the house and ride your ATVs and SxSs to the trails from Hazels Place.  You're also able to ride from the house to restaurants, gas stations, grocery stores and much more.  After a rough day on the trail, come back to a beautiful home with 4 bathrooms to clean up in and relax by the circular firepit.  Full Kitchen available for feasts.

Lorton Lick Road, between Bluewell and Montcalm, WV

1/3 acre parking lot
can ride ATVs / SxSs to the trails from the property

primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire house is available. There is a basement which may contain some owner storage, but is accessible if anything in needed.
sectionedDescription/description:
ATV FRIENDLY: 3 Bedroom, 2 Bath house near War, WV. Easy Access to the new Hatfield McCoy trail system and Outlaw trails. Within 7 minutes to War, WV, and 10 minutes to Berwind Lake to enjoy fishing, swimming pool, and hiking. A 20 minute drive to Welch, WV to enjoy the historic town and movie theatre. Parking out front and in back for trailers. Park and ride! Just off Warrior#16.
Surrounding towns are ATV friendly and you can travel to most restaurants by ATV!

ATV FRIENDLY! Ideal for large family/large group gatherings. Spacious and Cozy cottage-style house with creek behind it, firepit, and charcoal grill. House has large dining and living space for groups to enjoy. Guests may bring air mattresses if more sleep space is needed. (Additional guest fees may apply).  Plenty of parking: in front, left side, and out back.

Entire house is available. There is a basement which may contain some owner storage, but is accessible if anything in needed.

We do not live close by, but we are available by phone or text to answer any questions or give recommendations.

Quiet residential neighborhood; on main road from War to Welch
Excellent location for access to Hatfield McCoy's newest trailhead: the Warrior Trail, and plenty of free local "Outlaw Trails" which lead you through scenic areas of creeks, hills, and small towns.

Roadside parking out front, and beside home. Parking for atv trailer out back with additional parking . Park, unload and ride ATVs anywhere you want to go.

Most restaurants in town close around 6, and the grocery stores close at 8. If you are arriving late, you may need to plan accordingly.

sectionedDescription/description:
5 bedroom 3 bath home built in 1920. This home can easily accommodate 20 guests. High ceilings and large rooms. Spacious yard to grill and enjoy the WV mountain air. 8 foot slate pool table! Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Unload and ride right from the house!

Entire house and garage
sectionedDescription/summary: 5 bedroom 3 bath home built in 1920. This home can easily accommodate 20 guests. High ceilings and large rooms. Spacious yard to grill and enjoy the WV mountain air. 8 foot slate pool table! Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Unload and ride right from the house!

additionalHouseRules:
Not suitable for infants and young toddlers due to safety issues, example, the home has stairs and there are no baby gates or cribs yet.

We ask, before checking out please leave the house as you found it. Please clean up what you have used. Thank you for being our guest.

1. Clean out the refrigerator and microwave then put the dishes in the dishwasher and please start it. Wipe down anything in the kitchen that has been used. 

2.  Put dirty towels in the hamper in the washroom. 

3. Sweep if needed, And take out the garbage to trash cans outside. 

4. Do Not remove bed sheets or spread. The housekeeper will remove for laundry.
 
5. Turn off heat/ air conditioner and lights in each room. 
  
6. Text CHECKED OUT through Airbnb App

Thank you for coming!

primaryHost/about:
Hello, we are Debbie and Wayne Muncy and we’re  excited to have been hosting since 2020. Wayne is a minister and we have worked in ministry for years. Wayne also works full time as a custodian and I am a retired nurse.  We currently take care of my mother and another lady who has been a part of our family for 23 years. We have two grown children and two little grandsons. 
We live here locally and have all of our lives. Our goal for our guests is to have a pleasant and enjoyable visit while here in WV. Please feel free to contact us anytime during your stay. We’d be happy to assist you.
sectionedDescription/access:
There is PARKING in front of the house, back and side, as well as, in the back across the alley road directly behind the house. The whole area is graveled. When unloaded there’s room to park. If you have several trailering, there is EXTRA PARKING available at the school located 4 houses down at the back entrance. It is very easy to see, can’t miss it. 
The water hose is on the FRONT side of the house if you need to wash off your ride. You can pull up an park there or pull the hose around the front to the other side and back if you’d like.
The storage building in back yard is not accessible to guests, neither is the basement.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located approximately 8 minutes to the Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail System. We are on Rt 16, part of the”Head of the Dragon” Motorcycle Riding Route in Caretta, WV.  You will have easy access to “The Warrior trail” at Caretta or at War. 
The house  sleeps 9 and there's space for addition air mattresses. We have gravel parking in the front, back and side of property. There is a HOT water on demand system, Cable TV, WiFi, kitchen, and washer/Dryer.

You can access the trail from Caretta or ride over to War which is a 6 min ride to Grants Supermarket🍎🍉🥦🥑and the local restaurants, The Owl,🌭🍟
The Holy Moly Cafe🍔🥗🍕🍽🥧 also 
Taco Todd’s 🌮and, A Scoop of Heaven 🍧🍦🧋
You can get gas ⛽️ at Hillbilly Market and purchase Trail permits. We also have Walgreens and a Dollar General. A two minute drive through town will take you to the Warrior Trailhead. You may travel anywhere on your ATV, or SxS.
Berwind Lake is about 4 miles from War. There’s fishing, Canoeing, picnics and a beautiful hiking trail to walk around the lake. The 💧lakes swimming pool 💧is open this season.
At  the upper end of the lake you can ride a dirt road across barewallow hollow which is a beautiful adventurous ride.

There is PARKING in front of the house, back and side, as well as, in the back across the alley road directly behind the house. The whole area is graveled. When unloaded there’s room to park. If you have several trailering, there is EXTRA PARKING available at the school located 4 houses down at the back entrance. It is very easy to see, can’t miss it. 
The water hose is on the FRONT side of the house if you need to wash off your ride. You can pull up an park there or pull the hose around the front to the other side and back if you’d like.
The storage building in back yard is not accessible to guests, neither is the basement.

We live locally and encourage you to contact us with any questions or assistance you may need. We would be glad to help with directions or points of interest. It is our goal to help your stay be enjoyable.

We are just a 6 minute ride to War, WV where we have Grants supermarket. There is a Walgreens, Dollar General, Hillbilly Market (where you can gas up your ATV). Restaurants are Holy Moly Cafe, The Owl, Taco Todd’s  and A scoop of Heaven across the street from the Dollar General. 
The Warrior Trail Head is in War, WV and the trail office to obtain trail passes. Berwind Lake is approximately 4 miles from War, WV  there is a pool at the lake. 
We are only a 20 min ride to Welch, WV from the house and Coalwood is 10 minutes, where there is a Country Corner Store on main road and gas available. At Coalwood you can take frog level road to the end and go to Wilmore dam

Welch has a Wendy’s, Goodsons Supermarket, McDonalds, Subway, KFC, PIzza Hut, Walgreens, and Welch Community Hospiital. A must try is the Sterling Drive In. You can find them online or look in our guidebook on  this listing. There is the Pocahontas Theater. In Welch, WV, and Linkous Park is in Welch.

Our county is ATV friendly. You are welcome to ride your ATV wherever you may want to go.

sectionedDescription/description: Cozy 1 bedroom, 1 bath log cabin located in a beautiful wooded setting just south of Beckley, WV.  Includes private hot tub, fireplace, fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer, cable TV, Wifi, DVD player, all linens provided, charcoal grill and much more.  The cabin is located within 30 minutes or less of some of southern West Virginia's most popular skiing, white water rafting, golfing, ATV riding, and zip lining destinations.

name: Mountain Momma - clean and convenient!
photos/4/caption: Seating for 6, wings fold down for more space around the room.
photos/10/caption: Extra towels, cleaning products, linens available in the living room closet.
primaryHost/about: I am a husband, a father of four and I enjoy good books.  We are a pretty relaxed family and we are very active in our community in southern West Virginia.  Please contact me with any concerns.
sectionedDescription/access: It’s all yours!
sectionedDescription/description:
Mountain Momma is an above-garage apartment in Iaeger, WV.  We are located just a few miles from the Outlaw Trails trailhead at Wilmore Dam, and 12 miles from the Hatfield McCoy trailhead in Welch.  Other nearby HM trails are in Gilbert and War.   The newly-remodeled home offers two bedrooms and one bathroom, with additional sleeping in the living room.   The kitchen has concrete countertops and soft-close cabinets.  A Dollar General store is 1/4 mile away, and we have parking for ATV's.

All of the work on this apartment was completed by 120+ volunteers from 10+ states in 2018-2019.  As Covid-19 has ended the mentoring internship program typically hosted in this housing, we are turning over a new leaf.

It’s all yours!

Our family lives adjacent to this building in our split-level home.  We have young kids who are very friendly and polite!  We will give you your space but are available for whatever you might need.  Our heart is to serve you, see to it you enjoy the stay and earn your 5-star review

We are on Route 52 in Iaeger, the main road in our county.  This is a safe small-town place.

Parking is across the street in an open field for vehicles with trailers.  If no trailer, use the driveway if it's convenient for you.

additionalHouseRules: I ask guests to avoid any scented (fragranced)  body lotions,  colognes, shampoos etc  in the house. Other guests may also be staying here who have allergies and sensitivities. And for housekeeping, it can take multiple washings to remove some scents.  I do offer fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, or  laundry soap as amenities that you are welcome to use!   GOATS: Please check with me before feeding them or opening gates. CHECKOUT: If your stay is on a Saturday, I request a 9 a.m. Sunday checkout, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed.Thank you!

primaryHost/about:
Part of what made us want to be an Airbnb hosts is the wonderful hospitality we've known in our own travels.  As native Appalachians, my husband and I have a deep love for this region and its people and the tradition of hospitality.  We are both artists of sorts--I'm a freelance writer/reporter and he is a rock 'n roll keyboard player and works in the local school system. And we manage a herd of dairy goats, mostly LaMancha breed. All with names and personalities. Our place is about 15-20  minutes off off I-77. We're close to the notable "Back of the Dragon" motorcycle routes. And very close to some beautiful backroad bicycle routes. The scenery is beautiful all seasons of the year but especially the fall. We hope you'll visit!

 As for the goats, they are "the greatest entertainers and the greatest time wasters" as my dad used to say. He was a vet and built the house as a home and office. So it has a sort of historic/museum feel in certain sections. 

We don't guarantee food as part of our Airbnb listing,  but I love to cook and if I'm cooking, you're welcome to join us if you don't have other plans. 

Last but not least, we  love to know a little about our guests beforehand so PLEASE make sure you fill out the "Describe Yourself" questions under the Airbnb profile section to speed along the booking process.

Safe travels!
sectionedDescription/access: Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)
sectionedDescription/description:
This is the best sleeping room in the house. Hot water radiator heat keeps the room warm in the winter and concrete floors keep it comfortably cool in the summer. There's access to a full bath with tub and shower but you must walk up a flight of stairs. I also try to keep the house as free from allergens/fragrances as possible for guests who have sensitivities (noted in House Rules below).

The wi-fi is very poor in the bedroom but great in the parlor room just down the hall.

Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)

I'm in and out of the spaces with shared access but your bed and bath are always private. I like to socialize and interact with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.

There's a great little biking road about 1/4 mile from my home that lots of bikers love to ride. About 5 miles away is a great mountain bike trail at the Blfd WV city park. For more serious bikers, there's the Burkes Garden trail. 
For hikers, Lincolnshire Park, about 13 miles away in Tazewell, has features so beautiful you will think you're in the The Hobbit's  "Shire." 
For other things to do and places to eat, see my Guidebook section of Guest Resources.

The Town of Bluefield, Va. operates Graham Transit. Graham Transit runs three deviated fixed routes throughout the area each day. I am a 5 minute walk from the closest bus route stop.  Bus route schedules are listed on the Town of Bluefield, Va. official website.

Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: I ask guests to avoid any scented (fragranced)  body lotions,  colognes, shampoos etc  in the house. Other guests may also be staying here who have allergies and sensitivities. And for housekeeping, it can take multiple washings to remove some scents.  I do offer fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, or  laundry soap as amenities that you are welcome to use!   GOATS: Please check with me before feeding them or opening gates. CHECKOUT: If your stay is on a Saturday, I request a 9 a.m. Sunday checkout, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed.Thank you!

photos/15/caption: Enjoy the sunrise on the porch.

primaryHost/about: Will and Amy. Faith, Family, Farming.
sectionedDescription/access: You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.
sectionedDescription/description:
You will relax and reconnect in this beautiful valley nestled in the Southwest Virginia mountains. Sit on the porch and soak up those mountain views. Relax in the hot tub and count the stars. Reconnect with your spouse as you unplug from the hustle and bustle. Rest, laugh, enjoy! 

The cabin is located on a working family farm. You can purchase beef, pork, and chicken to cook while you’re here or bring a cooler and take some home.

Take a break from life. Get away. Come relax in solitude or with your spouse. Reconnect with nature. Breathe in that fresh air. Observe wildlife and get a taste of life on the farm.

The cabin completely private, but if you’d like to visit with family or friends there is another cabin located on the farm too. Check out our other listing for Valley View Cabin. You cannot see the other cabin, but it is located a couple hundred yards away.

You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.

We are available by phone (call or text) if you need anything.  We can offer suggestions of things to do while here (folder of information in the cabin). If we’re around we’d be happy to show you around the farm.

We are about a mile off of Hwy 16 (Back of the Dragon). About 10 miles from Hungry Mother State Park (hiking, fishing, beach swimming area...). We’re 25 minutes from Marion where there is an adorable Main Street with shops and eateries.  We are about 45 minutes from Abingdon (Barter Theatre, antique shopping, dining, winery...).

We are not near any public transportation.

We are about 25 minutes away from town. So, you may want to plan to stop at the grocery store on your way in. There are plenty of great restaurants in Marion. (We have a list of restaurants and activities to do while here.) FYI: Many of the Marion shops/restaurants are CLOSED on Mondays!

On our farm we raise and sell pastured beef, chicken, and pork. If you plan to cook while you are here let us know and you can order some homegrown meat ahead of time and we will have it waiting in your fridge. (Sausage or bacon for breakfast, steaks, hamburger, chicken breast, pork chops...) Bring a cooler so you can take some beef, chicken, and pork back home with you. You can see what's available and order directly through our website www.oldrichvalleyfarm dot com.

This is a working farm. We ask that you are very careful around the animals and stay off of all farm equipment.

name: Warrior trail: Love Shack Caretta 879 ATV lodging
primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!

sectionedDescription/access: All access to the house
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom 1 bath creekside house located 7 minutes from War, WV. Just off Warrior trail#16. 
Surrounded by mountains and Outlaw Trails. Cozy dine in kitchen, comfortable living room with smart tv and wifi.
plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Creekside firepit and charcoal grill for outdoor entertaining.

All access to the house

Feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns, or if you just want advice on some of the Outlaw Trails.

This house is located just minutes from access to Warrior Trail # 16, from the town of  War for restaurants, gas and groceries, and from Berwind Lake for scenic route and relaxation.

There is parking available on both sides and in front of this house for trucks and trailers. You can ride your ATVs almost anywhere you want to go from this house.

Local grocery store and restaurants are only 7 minutes away. Most close by around 8 pm if not earlier. The gas station remains open until around 11 pm.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

name: Coaldale Condo
photos/4/caption: Large patio firepit, grill, tables chairs.
primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.

This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

sectionedDescription/space:
This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.
sectionedDescription/summary: This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.

photos/1/caption: Perfect for families or small groups. Cozy, clean, comfortable relaxing area for after you have played on the trails all day.

primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back in time. Rural America. Before fast food chains, and even before Walmart...
Surrounded by mountains and located just a stones throw away (1/4 mile) from Hatfield McCoy's trail head Warrior and many outlaw trails. Enjoy High Rocks and Wilmore Dam, or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, or hiking.
Easy access to restaurants, gas, and grocery store. We are an ATV friendly town and house is located in a friendly Quiet neighborhood with plenty of parking.

The house features 2 bedroom, 2 bath full house that sleeps 8 comfortable. Living room, eat in kitchen and laundry area. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishes, utensils, coffee maker, toaster anything you need. 
Fully equipped with towels, and clean linens are on all the beds. Also a wonderful porch with table, chairs and a propane grill to enjoy the outdoors.
The main bathroom is a Jack and Jill bath between the two bedrooms. 
Living room has a flat screen TV with a fire stick and WIFI.
Like us on Facebook to stay up to date on what's going on in the area.
This house has a suite ( duplex) that can be rented for larger groups.

Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.

Our mission is to make your stay at The Calvary House as enjoyable as possible. 
 We are locally owned and located directly accross the street up on the hill if you need anything. 

 We respect your privacy . We'll give you the space that you want or the help you may need.

We are located around the corner from Warrior Trailhead office. Warrior Trail has direct connections to Pinnacle Creek, Indian Ridge and Pocahontas Trail. 
Located off RT 16 part of the 91 mile Head of the Dragon Motorcycle Ride in McDowell County. Surrounded by beautiful scenery.
 
Quiet Neighborhood in a welcoming small town with all the conveniences.  Restaurants, Grocery Store and gas station and car wash.

War is an ATV friendly town as well as the surrounding communities. 
You can ride in town and directly to the Trailhead.

Day Trips in the area:
86 Miles to New River Gorge
64 Miles to Beckley Exibition Coal Miner Youth Museum

** Check out our other Listings**
Calvary Suite
The Cove House
Cove Suite
